Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view”
Reviews.Author: SHVISH
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing view of the the Bosphorus and the bridge however one has to take care as to which side the room faces. The floor numbers can be misleading (9th floor is actually the ground level since the hotel is on a hilly tract) so seek floor higher than 10 and choose the east side. The rooms need refurbishing since the hotel is a bit old. The hotel is always buzzing with activity, the staff is very helpful, choice of F&B is excellent and the faciltities are very good. I specially like the breakfast spread at Cafe Swiss specially if one can find a place to sit on the terrace of the cafe. I have stayed there 4-5 times now and only time I didn't stay there was because the hotel was full.

Reviews.Title: “They really shouldn't use Bosphorus in the name”
Reviews.Author: travelingbeta
Reviews.Content: Location: This is the problem with the place. It's pretty far north of IST airport and really not walking distance to the heart of istanbul. You can't walk anywhere and there's no subway station nearby. Yes, it's right next to the Bosphorus, but you cant' really walk to it nor can you really see it from your hotel room. For the tower that i was assigned, just the first room in the end can see the bosphorus. that's if you're lucky you received that room. unfortunately, i had the other end. i only stayed here for the bosphorus and feel i got jipped. it's just too far from the action. without traffic, it'll be about 10 lira to taxsim square by cab. from/to the airport, it'll cost about 70 lira by cab. you'll use the cab a lot if you need to travel out of this hotel, which is why i'm giving you these reference points. hotel: security is super tight. when you get thru with a taxi, there's a person checking underneathe the car and the trunk. and, when you walk in, there's a metal detector you walk through. does it ruin anything? not really. but i don't feel safe or unsafe. just neutral. the grand, open lobby is the place with the amazing view of the bosphorus. that's about it. had a glass of wine and cup of coffee that totaled US$30. yeah.... rip, but that's hotel prices for ya.... the best thing about this place was the concierge. they were super willing to help make restaurant reservations for you or help you find a location in a map. room: clean and modern within the bedroom. bathroom is spacious, but the showertub can do some work. there was no shower door -- just some rinky dinky window shielding some splash. staff did a good job cleaning up the place and making it homely with a turkish delight treat for you in the evening. there's complimentary water and wifi, so those are big pluses to me. most luxury hotels don't offer them for free. breakfast: not included.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Istanbul Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissBabblicious
Reviews.Content: We arrived here straight from the airport and got amazing service from the moment we arrived. When we checked in, the front desk manager, Utku Dizdar, said he was upgrading me because I'm a travel agent. Not expected, but certainly welcome! When he saw it was my birthday, he upgraded us to the Bosphorus corner room. Before we could even finish unpacking, there was a knock at the door. Mr Dizdar had sent up a small cake and a bottle of wine also for my birthday! I was speechless- he had gone above and beyond to make this a VERY memorable birthday. This room was an absolute dream. Words cannot even describe the view. We left the curtains open so that we could wake up to the sunrise every morning. What a fabulous way to start a morning! Their champagne breakfast buffet is maybe a little pricey compared to everything else in Istanbul but definitely worth it. Omelet station, crepe station, breads, pastries, cheeses, homemade jams and compotes, nuts, cereals, and everything else you could want. Not to mention the superb staff there. We spent at least an hour there each morning. As for other reviews about this hotel being in the middle of nowhere, those people clearly didn't bother to walk around and explore. You are less than a 10 minute walk from Nisantasi which is a very chic and upscale part of Istanbul. It is a shoppers dream with everything from Gap and Banana Republic to Gucci, Prada and Alexander McQueen. If you walked down the hill, it was a 10 min walk to Dolmabahce Palace. 5 minutes further was the main hub of buses, metros, and ferries. The metro took you straight to Sultanhamet and was only 2 pesos. Taksim was probably a 15 minute walk away. If you stay here, there is NO reason to have to take a cab because everything is a short and beautiful walk away. They have a great spa with a pool, sauna, steam room, and whirlpool. They also have a fitness center with daily classes as local residents also use it as their gym. This is actually really nice as you meet locals and find out the cool, non-touristy places to go. The views from everywhere in this hotel along with the top-notch service are what make this hotel so outstanding. It was a perfect way to start our trip and I highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience !”
Reviews.Author: Antonio G
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent service, excellent rooms, excellent views, excellent restaurants, excellent bar !!. with fantastic views even from the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience I had so far in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Liteworker
Reviews.Content: Expensive? Yes!, but you get what you pay for ! Excellent location, excellent service, excellent rooms, excellent views, excellent restaurants, excellent bar. Worth it ? yes. Only minor thing I would say was the price of the buffet. I thought that was really exaggerated. I mean...it's a buffet ! not a Michelin star "nouvelle cuisine" But that was the only thing I could find as a negative point to this hotel. I would recommend it to all, if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MarioDelMonte
Reviews.Content: Very nice and cozy rooms, specially the ones with a great view to The Bosphorus. Excellent service, very good restaurants, specially the Miyako and The Gaja (fantastic food and service in both). Really very nice and clean spa, with very good swiming pool, jacuzzi, saunas and hamam. Very polite and good service. CafÃ© Swiss just in the entrance is perfect. So is the lobby bar for a light meal and a glass of champagne at the end of the afternoon!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Views”
Reviews.Author: Beahive
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, wonderful views, supberb buffet breakfast even if a little expensive. Having two towers (East and West) makes it a bit confusing but overall an excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mohamed e
Reviews.Content: u will enjoy every single moment with these professional crew everthing is as u order and they never except less than excellent hospitality for thier guests, it's some how far from taksim but u can take telephrik to taksim by only 2 T.L about 1.2 $

Reviews.Title: “Boshporus coast view”
Reviews.Author: Yopie230480
Reviews.Content: Fastactic view when you enter the main lobby, you can see the bosphorus coat directly from the lobby... Blue sea that divided two continent.. Clean room, very hospitality and nice person. Very tasty food

Reviews.Title: “Swisshotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Doug G
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights, very attentive staff, very clean and well kept hotel. Breakfast buffet is outstanding....... Have good security to drive on property must pass guard house and barrier's, metal detector when accessing lobby. The worst aspect is the cost of internet for your room, about $25 a day...ouch! Location is okay not great depending on what your doing.......near river, but a good little walk and uphill coming back. Nice view of river from the lobby lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “View, service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: HaniMustafa
Reviews.Content: I was in a conference in Istanbul and this was my first time to stay in this marvelous hotel. The location is excellent on the Bosphorus, so I recommend to ask for a room on the higher floors and on the Bosphorus. The location is in the city, so you can access many thing you like. The staff are friendly and cooperative. The rooms are well furnished and comfortable. The service are excellent and the rooms are clean. The restaurant for the breakfast is having many varieties, with excellent service. The value of the money, it is excellent when compared with other hotels in Istanbul or even in Europe or in the nearby areas.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in bitter need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: mipdantravel
Reviews.Content: Our last stay in Istanbul was all about friends seeing friends so we converged on the Swissotel allthough we normally stay at the Four Season Bosphorus. The Swissotel is a different price category but you would still expect some cutting edge accomodation from a "Leading hotel of the world". The entrance, hotel lobby and bar + restaurants on the lower floors are definitely glam bam eighties but not fit for 2012. It is a very big and very busy hotel. Expect conventions and groups to occupy large parts of the foyer and the lobby at all times. Reception was very polite and swift, off we went to the executive club lounge which is comfortable, well stocked and where you will find an extremely courteous welcome. Service through the 4 days of our stay was immaculate. The room, upgraded compliments of leaders club, was the letdown. Spectacular view, no terrace and if you tried to open the window slits to get some fresh air a spectacular draft set in. The room was totally overheated (in wintertime Istanbul gets pretty cold) and it took us 2 days to cool it off to a somehwat comfortable range. Furnishings again very 80s and outdated, but in reasonable shape. Espresso machine with one capsule of espresso and one capsule of decaf (period). Control of lighting was cumbersome and not adapted (only one side of the bed could control the lights, including what was supposed to be a reading light. Functional bathroom (luxury Sheraton 70s style), but do not attempt to draft a warm bath as the tub takes over an hour to fill (no pressure). The shower changes from cold to scolding hot water within the blink of an eye. Bath products were ample and adequate.Quality of bedding was ok, although upon arrival our bedsheet was ripped and damaged.Cleanliness and housekeeping as expected (very high standard). Breakfast at the buffet restaurant is a very pedestrian and typical large hotel affair which is a functional way of getting as many people in as little time as possible through the procedure. The executive lounge is a welcome respite from this madness and was very appreciated. One evening out at Gaja restaurant showed what Swissotel is capable of. We have been a dozen times to Istanbul and could witness the quantum leaps this city took lately in the restaurant and hospitality business. At Gaja restaurant Swissotel offers a world class culinary experience for the seasoned gourmet. We like to be surprised by a good restaurant and surprised we were. Cudos to chef William Mahi who will surely turn this hotel restaurant in the Istanbul frontrunner on the local restaurant scene within a few months from now. All in all: a good solid large hotel which offers very good service, a fanatastic restaurant but is outdated and offers non functional rooms which apparently are due for a complete makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business, lousy for tourism. In a word: TRAFFIC!”
Reviews.Author: Kippendavie
Reviews.Content: I was at Swisshotel for a conference and was very impressed. The rooms were large and comfortable, the staff helpful, the breakfast tasty, the hotel attractive and with a breathtaking view of the Bosporus. If you're thinking of holding an event here or you're a traveler with business in the Taksim area, I highly recommend it. But if you're in Istanbul to see the sights, don't stay here. Swisshotel is up on a hill, in the middle of nowhere. Even to walk the short distance to Taksim is nearly impossible, given the network of busy, impassable, unwalkable roads. But to take a taxi to Sultanahment? Forget it. 45 minutes easy, each way. I spent an awkward quarter hour just standing with the doorman out front waiting for a taxi to show up. None of this is the hotel's fault, but it's a big strike against.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: dima1623
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice with nice rooms, bathrooms were clean and lobby was big and spacious. YET, it is rated as "leading hotel of the world" so I just expected more out of it in regards to the rooms. Nothing to complain about though. View from room is amazing through the glass window. The only problem we had, is that we went during Eid, and the first day of Eid at the buffet restaurant was horrible. it was very crowded we had to wait in turn for one hour. then we got a table that the sun hits, almost all tables were like that and they cant close the curtains. The smell of eggs was all over the place (even outside the restaurant) and food was not reloaded. We payed for entering the restaurant but we only had couple of bites and left quickly. When we complained, staff was really nice and polite. They treated us with candies at the room. location might be a problem for some. as it is hard to walk into the main streets, or to taksim square like some other hotels. you need a taxi wherever you plan to go from the hotel. such hotel should have a kids playroom, especially that they had it open during the first day of Eid and it was somehow rich of kids toys, movie played, and a princess (who was somehow useless, wasnt interacting with kids or playing with them, she was msging on her phone all the time). Surprisingly, the kids room was only for one day.

Reviews.Title: “Aged two stars hotel at 5 stars price”
Reviews.Author: pascalakis
Reviews.Content: Poor services, poor food, aged small rooms. Taxi needed to visit any part of Istanbul. My only two positive points here, the top roof lounge and Bosphorus view.

Reviews.Title: “IN NEED OF A LITTLE TLC”
Reviews.Author: BEORMUND
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights to complete our trip to Istanbul, so that we could look out over the Bosphorus from our Hotel room. We were not disappointed as we sat looking out from our bedroom window towards the Bosphorus Bridge at night, watching as the lights on the bridge changed colour like a kaleidoscope. Minor problem on the 11th floor, which was supposed to be non-smoking....some of the guests in other rooms, continued to smoke, sothat corridors and common areas all smelt badly of smoke. Management were very kind and upgraded us to an executive suite on the 17th floor to escape the fumes. Very nice of them. Staff could not do enough for us. Very attentive and courteous, and full of helpful information.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elena123_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good located,near the Business district,near to the Shopping area -Nisan Tasi,only 15 min by walk. The lobby is fantastic,a lot of space and everything. We had a room on the executive floor (17th) and the very good thing was the Executive Loundge there-there we had our breakfast with the greatest vuew over the Bosforus,at 6PM there is Happy Hour with free drinks and this same spectacular view but with all the lights. They have a good internet in the rooms,not free unfortunately,but free in this Executive Loundge. The SPA is very good,the only place where I saw a steeam bath with some selt spread in the air which is fantastic for the skin. We did not tried the restaurents in the hotel but seems like they are also good. The only remarque I finally have is that the hotel is not new i think- rooms look a bit oldy but goody still:) So,to summarize - a nice place to go in winter (or spring). This year we will try it also in summer and then I will write another review.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and dated”
Reviews.Author: Kims0304
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for a week-long conference. As Sunflowers by the Sea rightly says, The Swissotel The Bosphorous is five stars and part of the Leading Hotel of the World collection, but the criteria for these is questionable. The rooms are dated. I was upgraded to a room with a better view - of the parking lot. The rack rate posted in my room was 800 euro. The room was no better than a standard room at an older Marriott. Some of the furniture could use a spruce and the light switches are positively puzzling. There is no extra plug next to the bed to charge your phone, so I had to unplug the night light each night. I liked the Purovel bath products, but because of the half screen on the side of the bath tub and the big gap between the wall and the screen, after having showered there would be a large pool of water next to the tub. Very annoying. Everything here is overpriced. Bar drinks average 17 euro for a cocktail. They charge 19.95 euro a day for WiFi. Outrageous. In this day and age, where internet access is expected. Boutique hotels like Hotel Amira offer WiFi for free; any large hotel should be ashamed to charge for WiFi, let alone that much. As we were here for a conference - and it snowed non-stop, we didn't have a chance to leave the hotel much. The buffet food was the same every single day, lunch and dinner. The same steamed vegetables, the same chicken and salmon dishes, the same rice pilaf, and the same desserts. Judging from the quality of the food by day 4, some of the food wasn't just the same recipe, but literally the exact same food. If you have to stay here for business, you'll find the staff very friendly and the turndown service with complimentary water is nice. If you have a choice, stay somewhere else. Istanbul offers a wealth of boutique hotels in more interesting neighborhoods. Avoid this overpriced, middle of nowhere, antiquated place.

Reviews.Title: “quite good”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: good location. nice sea views if you're in the right room. The spa is recommendable after a hectic day. The concierge had good advice on restaurants and handled the bookings. Breakfast was a bit of a letdown. The cafeteria cannot seem to cope if the hotel is fully booked. There was a long cue and once inside service was slow. Quality of food is good though.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LACATraveler1
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel The Bosphorus Istanbul is a great place to stay. The hotel is on a hill and the view from the lobby is definitely spectacular. The hotel is well located within walking distance of Dolmabahce palace and the Kabatash pier and about 20 minutes by Taxi from the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet is amazing. A number of good restaurants are located within 10 minutes walking distance on the other side of the park adjacent to the hotel. About 15 minutes walking distance from the hotel one can find many local shops and places to eat. I could see the Bosphorus from my room. The air in Istanbul is clearest in the morning and evening, there seems to be the same sort of haze as in Los Angeles, not surprising in a city of around 15 million. I gave a presentation to 100 people at the hotel and the meeting went smoothly. The only negative from my perspective was the daily charge of almost 20 Euros a day for use of the internet (which is free in most of the four and five star hotels in Europe where I have recently stayed).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rooms a bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: Somit12 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All in all a great stay, beautiful hotel, the rooms are a bit outdated and could do with some refurbishing. The pool area is very nice and the breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THE BEST BUT VERY GOOD.....LOT OF MONEY FOR WHAT YOU GET,”
Reviews.Author: SURFER_DUDE44
Reviews.Content: First of all this is one of the lower end "Leading Hotels of the World" properties I have been in. Staff is exceptional and tries very hard to please. The buffet breakfast is one of the best I have ever experienced (see my review of Shangri La Cebu, Philippines for the other). The rooms are getting a little tired, but if you have a Bosporus view you can overlook that part. Location is okay depending on your needs. Istanbul is a huge and fantastic city to explore and this place makes a decent hub to do that. It's fun to have breakfast in Europe and take the ferry across to have dinner in Asia. However there is not a lot of bang for your buck here. For the same money I am going to try Shangri La next time.

Reviews.Title: “Leading Hotel of the World? Really?”
Reviews.Author: sunflowersbythesea
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a week's stay at the Swissotel The Bosphorus, I was really surprised on a number of accounts... The Swissotel The Bosphorous is five stars and part of the Leading Hotel of the World collection... Couldn't help but wonder if the hotel is holding on to these ratings for posterity's sake or the 'judges' have seriously changed their criteria. For the amount of money you pay at this hotel (rack rate quoted at 400 EUR!) we had it for 200 EUR, you would expect so much more. Instead, the hotel gets you at every turn. WiFi at 19.95 EUR a day. Really?! The bar drinks averaging 15.00 - 20.00 EUR for a mixed drink.... And the food - apart from the delicious breakfast, we literally saw the same food everyday on the buffet. This included desserts! Unacceptable for a five star hotel. I stayed in an average room in the West Tower on the 12th floor. The rooms had an 'antique feel' - I'm sure the carpets and fixtures were expensive at some point, but now they seem outdated in need of repair. The bath products were nothing special either (never heard of the brand) and didn't even include hair conditioner. Thank goodness there was turndown service... (with a bottle of complimentary water included!) The spa and its assortment of saunas, the indoor pool was really nice - worth a visit - but terribly annoying that they try to sell you products after a treatment. The concierge staff were very helpful - though you couldn't help get the feeling they were sending everyone to the same places (as we discovered). Highly ironic that there are a couple high end jewel and dress shops, along with a florist specialising in beautiful orchids, but there is no drug store or gift store. "It is closed, finished," was the standard response. Forget your toothpaste? the savvy owner of the 'bookstore' has a small stash. Honestly, I was expecting so much more from such a hotel by its name and ratings. If you want to stay in Istanbul there is a wealth of small boutique hotels - more centrally located next to historic Istanbul that will look after you, while giving you superior service and value for money. The Swissotel The Bosphorous - been there, done it and won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Tiger1973
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, luxury hotel with extremely attentive staff. The hotel has a grand scale from the moment you enter the lobby and lounge which cascades down to the restaurant and the floor to ceiling glass that gives you lovely views of the Bosphorus. You feel like you're staying in a very luxurious hotel very quickly. Very helpful staff, i was on a tight schedule and overnight they were able to print off the boarding passes for our party and deliver them personally to each of our rooms. Nothing was too much trouble. Excellent quality food and drink, the breakfast buffet was very comprehensive and beautifully presented and served. We didn't do it justice. Rooms (mine was just a standard "classic") were good size, very clean (as was all parts of the hotel) and had everything you needed. Colleagues used the swimming pool and spa and said it was excellent. All members of the party i was in said they would come back to the hotel and explore Istanbul properly. Would definitely return. You can't go wrong with this hotel for a splendid stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: lhreye
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the center of Istanbul surrounded with beautiful grounds and breathtaking views of the Bosphorus. Our room was spacious and luxuriously appointed with traditional european style fittings and furnishings. We visited Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque which are both a short distance away. The buffet breakfast was good. The staff are warm and welcoming and added to our experience.

Reviews.Title: “great view, great food, great location”
Reviews.Author: duwayo
Reviews.Content: I don't really think that anyone would be sorry to stay in this hotel. The location is great, just walking distance to Nisantasi where you can shop from the best boutiques, Dolmabahce Palace is right across the hotel, you can see it from your room. I have stayed in executive rooms and the room service was just perfect. Staff is always kind and trying to please you all the time. Overall, it is a very nice hotel in a perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Daffels
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with excellant customer service. We had a problem with our room - paint fumes from renovations in one of the towers. The management immediately upgraded us - without hesitation. You will enjoy the old European charm and luxurious accomodations. Just watch out for expensive prices for snacks at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail N
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay in Istanbul. It's not far from Nisantasi district where you can meet all famous brand boutiques. Also the great view to the Bosphporus.Once we saw the submarine on the water crossed the Bosphorus. On other side you can see Beshiktas stadium, it's 5 minutes walk downstairs. Historical district the Sultanahmet is about 10-15 minutes by taxi. We enjoyed our stay there. Swimming pool was good and jacuzzi very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helena F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel last December for 3 days on vacations. The location of the hotel is great with amazing views all over the city. They upgraded us to the executive floor so the room was gorgeous. Service was very good and we only had breakfast at the hotel which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DrRedhead
Reviews.Content: We were a group of people on an "Art History" tour and stayed at this hotel. It was quite wonderful. On our floor, we had housekeeping who entered every time we left our room, refreshing our room. We had the buffet dinner which was delicious and quite attractive an environment, made especially so by: Mr. Sinan and Mr. Nedin who provided us with fantastic service, going above and beyond when we asked about a particular fruit used as a garnish. They brought some from the kitchen in order for everyone at our table to sample the fruit, "golden cherry". We thank these two men especially for making this meal memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: daniyah
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights, in january 2012. The hotel has every amenity you would want from a 5 star. The room was spacious and we upgraded to a room with the sea view. The view was ok but not worth the extra 50 euros per night. The bathrooms were not as plush as i would have expected. Breakfast was excellent, with a huge variety of dishes. I got the use the leisure facilities, which were excellent and the staff were very helpful. Although the location is quite far from the main attractions, the hotel itself is worth every penny. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “a gem and a diamont on one ring”
Reviews.Author: Figen_77
Reviews.Content: It took us some savings to be able to stay here, but we still found it relatively inexpensive. It is a continuous warm shower that starts the moment you get off the airport taxi and head towards reception. From then on it is all warm welcomes and warm stays. The rooms are not the biggest we have seen but are more than sufficient and it is the only point we could find at all. So we had to search for it :) The views are amazing due to the hotel's location and view over Istanbul's Bosphorus. This is one of the few hotels we would go back to... worth every dime spent!

Reviews.Title: “Calm on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: sbat
Reviews.Content: Was in Istanbul Dec 2011 and stayed at the Swissotel the Bospherous . A beautiful hotel on the Bospherous with all the trappings of a 5 star hotel . Clean rooms with great views - if you can stay on the East Wing . Great breakfast , superb concierge service esp Murat -very helpful in booking resteraunts , very knowledgeable about the city and its wonders . Istanbul is a place where the east meets west and its this mix thats greets you be it the spice bazaar, or grand bazaar or the numerous shops , street vendors, monuments . The sightseeing , numeorus shops , bazaars however are in Sultanamet which is a 15 min taxi drive in the morning and a 45 min drive if you and you will get caught in evening traffic at some time . So if you want to be where the action is and save your self the agony of getting caught in traffic every time you venture out stay in Sultanament , its got tons of hotels ,cafes, easy to reach monuments, and is more lively place i feel. The Bospherous is however the calm in the whole storm of activity and if you like to come back after an action packed day to some peace and calm then the bosperous side is for you. Sitting by the waterfront or watching the last ferrys depart from their piers from your hotel with the lights all lit on both sides is just very peaceful and a nice way to end your day, esp in December when its cold . Having said that all the five star hotels or most of them are in this area and so if 5 star hotels and their dinning is your thing then this is the place to stay . The Dolmache palace is also the only main monument close . Some of the premier night clubs are also to be found on this side but its mainly quite after dark unless you head up to walking street where the action is which is about 10 min walk from the hotel. So just as Istanbul is all about the east and west so is Sutanament and the Bosperous . Both areas have their charms Familys and Business minded people ,,or those who just want some peace after a full day may prefer this side over the other Buts thats just Istanbul......

Reviews.Title: “Meeting high expectations”
Reviews.Author: SDtraveller55
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel in a great location. It is only a few taxi minutes away from Taksim Square in a very quiet area and has a fantastic view. Everything is working here. Friendly and and well trained staff. Rooms are nicely refurbished. Roof restaurant is excellent. Not only for the view. Service is friendly and professional. Food is maybe not exciting, but the quality is very good. Request a room with Bosphorus view!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel in the heart of everything”
Reviews.Author: Jaspreet G
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, but a little pricey. Great restaurants from a Swiss Chalet restaurant to cozy lounges. We were there for 5 nights including the New Year. The lobby has a great view of the Bosphorus. The negative part is they charge for every little thing, including the Internet which is 6 euros an hour. These days 95% of the hotels in the world give internet for free as it costs nothing, but this hotel charges a bomb for it, not sure why. Other than that, the hotel was fantastic, service was fabulous. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to be close to everything in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes you wish you could stay longer”
Reviews.Author: 100NightsPlus
Reviews.Content: I travel to Istanbul several times a year and this is the first time i have stayed in "The Bosporus". This trip was only for a one night stay and I can only say that my experience has been good. After arriving at the hotel the check in process was friendly and efficient and my room with a view of the Bosporus was very nice. Just everything you need and can expect from a hotel of this class. I have only had breakfast and lunch in the hotel as we ventured out in town for dinner. About the BF and lunch i can only say good things - both in selection and quality. We had meetings in the separate building (which i believe also houses apartments) and the meeting rooms and service provided were extremely good. So overall a very good experience with only one "negative" experience. I had a hotel limo pick-up from the airport (nice large and clean car) and was somewhat amazed by the fact that the driver was immediately offering to arrange some female company for my stay at the hotel. To me that was just something i would not have expected from a limo driver for a hotel of this standing.

Reviews.Title: “Best hospitality in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: abdi a
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and helpful, Brunch was great!!, The room is very well furnished , indoor pool, turkish hamam and the spa is awesome, I stayed in a Bosphorus view room it costs a little more but well worthed it. Concierge is really professional , I am definetely staying there during my summer vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Fadious007
Reviews.Content: In short, Swissotel is good but not great. Things I liked about the hotel include great view (my room had a sea view), grand view from the lobby, excellent facilities including great spa gym in door pool, and my experience with the concierge was excellent (they were the best staff in the hotel). A sea view room could make this hotel enjoyed best by honeymooners. Now as for the bad, the front desk staff were not as helpful, I was checked in to double room bed which are small instead of one king size bed, room rate is somewhat high, I caught error in extra billing (this was corrected fast but these things shouldnâ€™t happen), my reservation was supposed to have internet connection and 1 complementary dry clean for some reason on check in this was not included in my room, my breakfast was included in the room rate but first morning I was stopped by staff checking names for breakfast because she couldnâ€™t find my name, she called someone and after 5 â€“ 10 minutes she let me in. Finally, location is not within walking distance from Taksim square, you will need a 5 minute ride by taxi to get to this area, which in my opinion you will enjoy any other hotel much more if it was within walking distance from Taksim squire. Donâ€™t get me wrong, with all these issues, the hotel is still good, the room is very nice and spacious, and view is maybe one of the best in Istanbul. Yet, my opinion is if you are in a city (not in a beach resort) then you donâ€™t need fancy hotel as much as you need to be close to where the exiting events are. I have stayed at Helton Istanbul before and it is closer to Taksim Area, service level is about the same but at least it is closer to Taksim.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: AussieNarelle
Reviews.Content: I have never been so confused about rating a hotel. You step out of e taxi and they have already checked your luggage for your name and greet you by name, ensure you can find reception. As someone else said, nice foyer - very grand. And then I got to check-in. Thought I had a room with access to the executive lounge, but apparently not. Reservation was quite confusing to me, but then apparently it was also confusing to the receptionist. She told me I did not have breakfast included in the rate and I did not have Internet access. I assured her I did and once I went to show her the reservation she suddenly noticed these were included plus a newspaper, dry cleaning and an evening cocktail...and I could have the evening coktail in the executive lounge! Get to my room and am very happy as the window opened. No view to speak of, well unless the cars arriving excite you. Was supposed to have a view of the park - did not appreciate this meant the car park. Based On the views from the restaurant go for the rooms with a view of the Bosphorus. Bed was comfortable. WiFi was very intermittent and so glad it was included in my rate as otherwise I would have been very annoyed by the spotty reception. Bathroom had a close up mirror and large bench. But for a hotel of this class not to have hair conditioner was an insult. Went and bought a bottle so that I had some. Then I went to the hamam. Awesome massage and sauna and steam room. Had a facial the next time. Fantastic treatments. The spa is excellent as is the indoor pool. There is a mosque close by and could hear the prayer to call before sunrise and the last call each night. Fantastic as I love hearing the call to prayer. Went to the Dolabache Palace. Very close, and the concierge told me of the quick way out of the hotel from the fifth floor past the pool - exemplary service. The food from room service was okay - the Turkish food was a bit disappointing. Breakfast was a nice spread with something for everyone. But strange breakfast experience on the second morning. I was seated and then came back from the buffet (having left my BB, paper and glasses at my place) to find two Turkish girls had planted themselves at my table at a table for two with only a setting for one! They acted like this was very normal. I was astounded and the wait staff just ignored the whole thing and brought them two extra places - it was bot crowded to scythe least! Then check-out. OMG - I was charged for numerous things from the minibar. I never use the minibar as my work does not reimburse. So they removed the items. And then I asked about the charge for the cash out. They told me I took a cash advance the afternoon before. I explained that that was not possible as I was at The Palace at that time and showed them my ticket. So then they said must have used the hairdresser, no not so. Finally they decided it was when I had my shoes shined. Now the hotel directory discussed a free shoe shine each night, but apparently I was wrong. I said in that case I would pay as that was mu misunderstanding and was not fair to the poor shoe shine guy. I know what the book said and I did not use the dry cleaning nor the cocktail each night. By this time it had taken me 20 minutes to checkout and I needed to get to my car (I was 10 minutes late). Room and desk in the room are a good size and a couple of outlet plugs at the desk level which was nice. As I have stayed at a number of different hotels in Istanbul, if I need to be in the Bekistas area again for business, will go back to the Intercontinental. The Swissotel was closer to my business meeting and the Palace hence the reason I chose it. So check-in and check-out were atrocious, but concierge was great. Waitstaff ignored locals planting them selves at my table, but spa was awesome. So very good and very poor - so overall a 3 rating, and oh get hair conditioner for the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: U2NyR
Reviews.Content: When you enter the hotel, the lobby is grand and beautiful, great place to meet with business associates. The rooms are big and well appointed. The bathrooms need work. The shower is not enclosed, so you freeze the whole time your in there and find yourself rushing to get out. Completely unenjoyable. They closed the Turkish restaurant but kept the Swiss restaurant opened (confusing). Location is a bit isolated, so you can't just walk to a restaurant for dinner. But the one thing that pissed me off most about the stay was the 20 euros per day for internet. More than i pay at home for 1 month. In 2011 to be charging for internet is unacceptable, and 20 Euros per day is insulting. I asked to be given access to the roof bar which is open during the spring and summer, so i can take pictures. Unhelpful clerk at the front desk just kept saying "it's only open in the summer".

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: aplamse
Reviews.Content: Very nice business hotel, great views if you go for the more expensive Bosphorus view room. On the expensive side but then so are all ither hotels in the area. Service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ITIR
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, a perfect landscape of bosphorus, and the breakfast had a lot of varieties. The japanese restauant Miyako is the first class... Ä° Will stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still very nice hotel for a break to beautiful Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Riad104
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay in Swissotel The Bosphorus - visiting Istanbul frequently we were happy to find a hotel with high-quality of service and nice accomodation located close to the main districts.We were not dissapointed - the hotel, although a little bit dated, is still the place which lets you stay comfortably and enjoy everything. Will definately go back many times more! Tip: the breakfast - even though a bit pricey - is one of the best you can find in Istanbul. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravellerMunich
Reviews.Content: Reading all the reviews and the prices I was expecting a really nice hotel. But disappointing. the rooms are not more than everage. The requested room type was not available. the comfort of the bed is okay but not good. The noisy from the rooms around and from the hallway is substantial even so the windows close nicely. The food served in the restaurant is not more then average. clearly not living up to the standards I would expect from a hotel of that category. the location is nice - overlooking the area and nice fews towards the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Great view; good location!”
Reviews.Author: HobSully
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and thought it was a good hotel. The view is fantasic and the staff are friendly and helpful. I ordered room service mostly and thought the food was great. Internet fee is above most business hotel charges ($6 Euro per hour/$19 per day). The hotel was able to accomodate my early check-in request.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent: wish i had had ore time to enjoy it”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: Well..this is a really outstanding hotel. The service is terrific, the location is excellent, the rooms are very comfortable and i love it. I am not usually very effusive but i totally enjoyed my very brief stay here. The staff really notch it up a grade when it comes to service. I am not a huge fan of the decor, but the lay out of the public areas really appealed to me. The other thing that i would note is that the area around is very trendy and some good bars and restaurants are close at hand. It is within reach of all the major sights. I normally stay in the Conrad which is also really good, but i will stay here next time out of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Brightskies56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago, and I forgot to write my review. All I can say is that this hotel is the best I have ever stayed in. We booked via Expedia and got an absolute bargain - hotel and flight as a package for less than the normal return flight from Heathrow to Istanbul. It was my birthday and there was a beautiful cake left in my room. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. It is spectacular. Only issue perhaps is the distance from here to Sultanamet, but we walked along the Bosphorus and took in all the sights. Stopped for coffee, had lunch on the Galata Bridge, went to the Grand Bazzar, Blue MOsque etc etc. I just love Istanbul - fullstop! And I just loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tanujpatel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located on a hillside with a 60 acre garden. The views are superb. You can see the sea from everywhere. The rooms are large and the bathrooms of a good size. The spa is very good. Many restaurants & shopping close to the hotel. Old city is only 20 minutes by taxi. The staff is very friendly. The bar is good but the coffee shop is not so good. Food in the hotel is not as per Turkish standards.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, amazing spa, very good service, but...”
Reviews.Author: cecastella
Reviews.Content: US style hotel, but with an Istanbul touch. Very convenient for both business and leisure. The outdoor/indoor swimming pools are just great. Appartment rooms in the parc are brand new and lavishly furnished, but hotel rooms need a bit of an update/refresh. Gret choice of restaurants, excellent food, but a bit pricy up to me.

Reviews.Title: “Far Below Average for an Alleged Five Star”
Reviews.Author: CJ G
Reviews.Content: Travelers beware Swissotel The Bosphorous: You will pay five star rates (US$400+), but get a standard business hotel experience. In a five star hotel, few details should be overlooked. Not so at Swissotel The Bosphorous: - The mini-bar was not refilled - Robes and curtains in a supposed non-smoking room smelling overwhelmingly of smoke - The TV in the room did not work - Some of the bedside lighting control were not functional While the service was good (as you would expect in a property of this caliber), it did not make up for the deficiencies in the condition of the room. In summary, Swissotel The Bosphorous is a slightly sub-standard business hotel at five star rates. If your company is paying for a business hotel and you cannot reserve the Grand Hyatt or other nearby property Swissotel The Bosphorous may barely suffice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosjuan
Reviews.Content: great view of the bosphorus from the restaurant and bar above Great service and facilities. Good Spa. The only point against is that location is good but to walk you have to go uphill.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: MinaGreece
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have been there a year ago for a romantic getaway weekend an it was the perfect choice. the only problem the prices into the hotel but if someone wants a five star hotel it is not unexpectable. i recommend it for its wonderful view to the Bosphorus bridge and for the luxury that everyone could enjoy sometimes!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better!”
Reviews.Author: PragmaticCinderella
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel. Stayed 3 nights on business. Good location, big standard room, very comfortable bed and pillows! Really great breakfast with lots of varieties, fresh juices, good coffee. The only stuff which is really annoyed me - check-in and chek-out. At check in they block on your credit card on the top of room rates additional amounts of 100 euro per night, without informing in advance at the booking stage. At check out they supposed to unblock remaining amount, but in reality it is still blocked after 1 week. my colleagues told me that sometimes it takes about 1 month to get your money unblocked. may be it is not big issue, but very unpleasant for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mudra1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel following a three week cruise. Must say it is definitely great location, service and all facilities are excellent. Room was large and comfortable and staff helpful and very accommodating. The breakfast is something special. We stayed in some great places all over the world but this is a notch above and our favourite so far.

Reviews.Title: “Embrace Excellence in hotel accomodation”
Reviews.Author: jamu_10
Reviews.Content: Never before in my life have I experienced this level of excellence,heartfelt service attitude and efficiency in hotel accomodation and guest services. It is simply perfect : friendliness and helpfulness of front desk staff, efficiency of check-in and check-out, concierge's knowledge of the resort and attentiveness to any special requests, room cleanliness and accomodation (even a Nespresso coffee machine and free coffee capsules are proposed for your enjoyment), comfortable bed and furniture, great dining experience in a large choice of dining venues (don't miss the Gaja Sky Bar and Restaurant with its breathtaking Bosphorus view), superb Turkish and international breakfast buffet ,etc,etc... really the sky is the limit ! Finally, the location of the hotel in this upscale area of Istanbul ,overviewing the Bosphorus, is probably the most selective you can possibly find. A short taxi drive will bring you to Taksim Square and the attractive Istiklal street with its premium shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “ABOUT THE NÄ°GHT AT SWÄ°SS BOSPORUS”
Reviews.Author: betty g
Reviews.Content: Ä°t was the most beautiful wiew that I saw from the window of my room.. <thanks alot to the staff of the hotel, from the restaurant to the reception everybody was perfect and well trained... forward to come back soon ....

Reviews.Title: “The Best Best Holiday Ever ....”
Reviews.Author: RachnaNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: I tarvelled with my husband and friends for my Bday. We stayed at the Swissotel LIVING the new ALL Suite product , must admit haven't seen anything so spectacular. State of the art rooms with fully functional kitchen and private serene pool.Excellent BF spread and Room Service !! Personalised services and super functional suites - so much space and Bosphorus views. Eda and Onor make a great front desk team together and ensure you fall in love with the hotel. They are so passionate about what they do. Thank you everyone !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing view, needs some improvement though”
Reviews.Author: FrequentBizTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Have been visiting this beautiful hotel for more than 15 years. On a number of occasions had family reunions there too as well as new year celebrations. I can say that I know the place pretty well. Had many odd experiences over time but also had far greater moments. The positive side - amazing views, spacious and clean rooms, very good F&B facilities, wonderful ambiance. The down side - overpriced facilities and f&b, rooms and bathrooms need refreshment, excellent location but inconvenient for walk around, a few times problems with the bills and lack of attention to complaints. Still recommended..

Reviews.Title: “impressive lobby and restaurant area”
Reviews.Author: Lana X
Reviews.Content: Good evening, I was lucky to stay in this hotel around Christmas time.The first who met me infront hotel was huge St.Bernard dog.He was drinking water and looks very friendly.I immediately feel that i going to like this place.This is nice hotel tradition to welcome you with this dog for ceremony of christmas tree lightening. Everyone can join this celebration later in evening enjoying complimentary glass of champagne and music :-) And this dog is hotel symbol and has own place here. Lobby is very impressive with huge windows and direct view to Bosphorus strait..So,you can seat in cafe or restaurant in lobby and enjoy ships movement. Rooms are very nice decorated and have side Bosphorus view,which is enough to enjoy the beauty behind windows. Staff friendly.And dont bother you.House keeping perfect do their job. Many people coming to this hotel for conferences.So,sometimes there is waiting line for taxi. Nice spa. Expensive restaurants. Excellent pools. Personally-its my favorite hotel in Istanbul.But twice i have got bad luck here with something which is not belongs to hotel.So,i become to be superstitios to stay here again. :-(((

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND LOVELY PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: Lynne P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here September last year and we could not complain at all, we were upgraded to The Club lounge at no extra cost, as a sporting club arrived to stay on the level we were on. We had a problem with our mattress which was quickly fixed up. We had a lovely view of the pool and Bospherus in our room. Breakfast was lovely. My only complaint is there was no wireless and was very expensive to use the internet. Also it is a little far to just to walk into the shopping area, or go to a restuarunt , . also had a very large hill when walking back from somewhere. In saying all that I would still stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not the best in the area”
Reviews.Author: jinks_eng
Reviews.Content: I have had a room with Bosphorus view; it was kind of expensive for the view, as the view was 'filtered'by some trees in the garden. Service was good, but nothing impressive; access is a bit difficult if you want to get there by foot; room is not impressive. One in all, hotel is good, but price is too high for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Good view and nice staff but very expensive Internet / Cable TV”
Reviews.Author: Abhinav P
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Istanbul (13-16 Sep 2011) for a business meeting. I stayed at the Swissotel during my visit. I had reserved a non-smoking room. Upon check-in I was told I would get a lawn facing view. I requested for a Bosphorus view and was given one - a smoking-room - but to my surprise a much bigger one than what I had booked. the view of the Bosphorus was great but the room smelled of smoke. I told the housekeeping and they did some ozone-treatment (or so they called it) while I was out having dinner and upon my return the smoke-smell was gone. So I got a bigger room than what I had booked with a Bosphorus view - what more could I ask for. Since I was out on business almost the entire time - I did not explore too much in the hotel. The buffet b'fast was quite good and elaborate with lots of choices and a nice indoor + outdoor seating arrangement. One major concern was the Internet cost - at EUR 20 per day (unlimited) - or Eur 7 per hour - it seemed a bit expensive. Same with TV. The free TV channels in the room were all crap and ordering a movie from the hotel was quite expensive again. Another concern is the location - from a traffic jam perspective. It took about 1 hour from the airport to reach in the hotel in mid-day (that is off-peak) hours. Also going out anywhere in the evening meant half an hour of traffic jam just 2-3 mins out of the hotel. The staff seemed quite nice and eager to help. Thanks. Cheers, AP

Reviews.Title: “Bosphorus hotel”
Reviews.Author: rolandpacteau
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 6 nights last week ( September 2011). An excellent 5 star hotel well deserving of its stars. Excellent food, service, meeting room facilities. All staff very courteous and helpful. Beautiful views of the Bosphorus, spacious and comfortable room, good aircon, excellent en-suite facilities. Can't be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: lillu2222
Reviews.Content: Never had I been asked for cash advance! I was asked to leave a cash advance or my credit card at the reception. I chose cash, since had the signed proof of it.

Reviews.Title: “Large and in charge”
Reviews.Author: Mary-EllenCallahan
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel, but the rooms and amenities are very comfortable. First class everything. Delicious food. Great service from ALL the staff. Nice spa facility and services. Luxury shopping in the lobby. It's been a pleasure looking forward to each next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for corporate/business event; too expensive for tourists”
Reviews.Author: vantooren
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in Swiss Hotel for years, for business purposes, and find this hotel the best choice in terms of price-quality value, for corporate events (conferences). Itâ€™s a 5 â€“start hotel , with excellent room and conference facilities, located in a price location, with a maginificent view over the Bosphorus, with top security in place, and still cheaper than peers like Ritz Carlton or Kempinski hotel , which are of comparable quality. However , for individual tourists I find this hotel too expensive. Rooms range between 180-300 eur, depends on the time of booking. Donâ€™t book the â€˜sea viewâ€™ rooms for 300 eur, as you will get the same room as for 180 eur and just a glance over the sea, soits not worth. Overall, here are the pro-s and con-s of the hotel Pro-s: - Excellent location, center of the city, in a quiet still place, on a hill, with a lovely view and with well functioning security system in place - Great rooms: a lot of space, quet airco, easy access internet, good TV, very comfortable bed, everything you need in there - Personnel speaks very good English, friendly and efficient - Top quality restaurants, Michelin â€“start food, roof terrace with breathtaking view - Cleanness â€“ top - Conference facility - top, with all equipment you may need, very good assistance, logistics - working very well ( restaurant, coffee breaks) and pricing - reasonable ( still expensive, but significantly cheaper than the other hotel offering similar service). Con-s - No shop available for small purchases, i.e. tooth paste , cigarettes, etc. all is run via concierge, who charges 10 times more. - If you get a fax - you have to pay eur 0.8 latest price, which is ridiculous. for this standard of hotel faxes should be for free ( or at least first 20 pages). - Expensive for tourists. Especially the drinks, food. Yes, they are top quality, but still - average bottle of wine price 100 eur - too much.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Isakka
Reviews.Content: great hotel combined with great facilities and a rich breakfast. Very convenient location whether you are in Istanbul for business or pleasure. nice swimming pool with massage booth on the grass giving you a tropical feeling. English speaking staff make your life much easier that you would normally find in Turkey. rooms are spacious with a good variety on their satellite TV. There is an hotel cafe next to the entrance where you can have an aromatic swiss espresso. Overall, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but good”
Reviews.Author: expecttobewondered
Reviews.Content: A very big hotel, with good facilities, generally in good shape. Very nice staff, the general level of English is good. Concierge and lobby staff always helpful. It is far away from the touristic zone and you have nothing interesting at walking distance (except the DolmabahÃ§e Palace), but on the other hand itâ€™s a short taxi trip and itâ€™s nice to have a big swimming pool and gardens. I booked an executive room. It was at the top floor and had an astonishing view over the Bosphorus bridge. The executive lounge was nice. Itâ€™s expensive, but I definitively recommend. The only shortcoming is that wi-fi connection should be free of charge and it is not (and costs around â‚¬ 20 per day)

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: OS123456789
Reviews.Content: Wonderful spacious lobby with view on the Bosphore best japanese restaurant in town very professional service wonderful business lounge amazing restaurant on roof top especially in summer spacious rooms BAD MATTRESSES rooms are getting old not very easy for walking access WONDERFUL swimming pool. the gym is top wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcguires54
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in August. We were upgraded to a Bosphorus view. The room was reasonably priced and came with breakfast every morning. Also included was an afternoon snack on the 17th floor. The pool area is very nice, as is the spa. The concierge made a nice recommendation for a local Turkish restaurant and in 5 minutes by cab we were enjoying an authentic and outstanding Turkish meal. My recommendation is that anyone staying here gets out of the hotel and out to a local restaurant whenever possible. We had a tour guide take us to the old city. The hotel is on the European side and it was an easy drive to all the major attractions. The hotel needs an upgrade at some point but don't be disuaded. The place is not shabby by any stretch of the imagination. The rooms certainly have flat screen tv's and they are very comfortable. This is a not an extravagant hotel in but you won't be dissapointed at all -- on the contrary you will be quite pleased that you get good value for very nice hotel. The service was good. Overall this is a 5 star hotel with a 4 star rating at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “The Best.”
Reviews.Author: Efficient86
Reviews.Content: I can not speak highly enough of this hotel. We only stayed in Istanbul for 2 nights but it was the most amazing part of our trip. Where to start.. the staff were among the nicest and most helpful I have ever encountered. We had our every request attended to and then some. We were given a beautiful room, looking straight at the Bosphorus Bridge, which was incredible and I honestly think the bed was the most comfortable thing I have ever slept on. No joke. We had access to the Exec Room, which just topped the whole thing off. Having drinks on the balcony there in the afternoon was something that I will never forget. We were told it is the best view in Istanbul and I don't doubt that for a second.. It's an incredible spot. The food was amazing. We also ate at the Geiya Restaurant, I think it was called, which is also on the roof top overlooking the Bosphorus. It was a stunning setting and amazing food. The pool area is fantastic with plenty of comfy chairs and plenty of room. My girlfriend and her friend went to the Amrita Spa and said it was an amazing experience. I decided to chill by the pool, which was great too. We mostly got cabs around the city, which at times felt pretty dodgy but the staff at the hotel do a fantastic job of telling you how much a taxi should cost to certain spots and even give you a card every time you get into one with all the relevant information. I looked at most of the other top hotels in Istanbul when I was there and nothing really looked to compare. We had an amazing time and can't say enough positive things about this place. Stay here, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views of the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Katarina F
Reviews.Content: With gorgeous views of the Bosphorus, this hotel is a marvelous place to stay in Istanbul. The staff is welcoming and guests are taken care to 5 star expectations. The spa is very well appointed and the pool is delightful when the weather is sunny. October is the transitional month, you will be fortunate to take advantage. Transportation can be easily arranged to all parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views perfect service”
Reviews.Author: SDLCyprus
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at this wonderful hotel during our 6 day stay in istanbul beginning of August. We stayed in an execuive room on 17trh floor. Room was spacious, and had all amenities that you would expect from a 5 star hotel in order to make your stay comfortable. The view of the bosphorous was unique. Staff in general but in particular in the executive lounge were most polite and helpful. The executive lounge was well stocked of all kind of drinks snacks etc during happy our, but also during the rest of the day you could help yourself to coffee tea etc. The hotel has excellent restaurants, beautiful gardens, 2 swimming pools and spa. Another advantage is that the hotel is located in a prominent place and it is within walking distance from an upmarket shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Only an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: tss
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at this hotel after a flight from Dubai to Istanbul made to connect with a Seabourn Odyssey Cruise on the following day. We therefore did not have a lot of time to spend at the hotel but we found the staff and service to be of a very high standard. The hotel itself is situated on a hill overlooking the Bosphorus and we requested and obtained a room with a view. Even though it was only overnight, it was worthwhile. Dinner at the hotel Japanese restaurant was unexpectedly good and the preceding self serve drinks and snacks were very welcome. We would stay here again should we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Gym and Great View. OLD TIRED ROOMS WITH AWFULL BEDS”
Reviews.Author: dhaigh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days. I have Leading Hotel of world Card so was "upgraded". Rooms are old, outdated and tired and beds not comfortbale. Room has amazing view of Bosphorus. Staff are very helpfull and faciliaties (Gym, SPA) are good. Hotel is being refurbished in 2012 - dont bother staying here until then. Much better at this price. The Swiss living portion of hotel has already been updated. Nice location for work, could walk to office. Door staff also helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taner_tr06
Reviews.Content: I stayed four days in this hotel at 18th floor. It was extremely wonderful. Very nice Bosphorus view, very kind stuff, everything was well organized. It is near to city center. Very delicious foods. I strictly advice you to stay this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views, Great Service, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SDubois
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in June on business. I have nothing but rave reviews for this hotel. The rooftop outdoor restaurant was very good and had fantastic views of the city and the Bosphorus. Similarly, the rooftop bar was a great way to finish off the day with friends and associates. Breakfast was included and was also extremely good and served in a charming outdoor balcony venue overlooking the Bosphorus. The rooms were very nice. Mine did not have much of a view but I imagine those with a view must have been quite spectacular. The pool area was also very nice. The gym left quite a bit to be desired by US standards but much better than what is typical for Europe/Asia. The service, overall, was top notch. I'd stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but some hicups”
Reviews.Author: gillprior
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and the rooms etc are lovely as well as the spa. The things that I wasnt happy with was the prices 30-35tl for a glass of wine, 15tl for a coke etc. Also the buffet resturant I feel they should have their prices on display and more so during Ramada month when the cost is a lot more before 9.30pm. When I checked out there was also a missed spa treatment on my bill, which I had not even booked, what I did do is go down and ask what they had available and then said I would phone if I would be back in time. Also watch out if you use the wifi on your iphone or ipad as I paid for 3 days and after the first day it stopped working I was then told oh yeah there is a problem with iphones. Also at the pool watch out if you order wine I asked for a glass of the Turkish wine I was given a glass of the more expensive turkish wine, I only found this out when I was given the bill after I had drunk the wine, I was told they dont normally serve the cheaper turkish wine at the pool bar!! Oh and I ordered a taxi from the desk and gave them the addtess where I wanted to go to as I dont speak Turkish, the taxi driver didnt even know the way to where I wanted to go so rather than the fare being about 35tl-40tl it was 50tl. I would have thought the hotel would make sure the taxi driver would know where they where going! Apart from that the hotel is lovely and you cant fault the rooms or the staff. I dont think I would return to this hotel mainly because of the high prices. I am going to try the Ramada Plaza next week for 4 nights for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual”
Reviews.Author: Travelite1969
Reviews.Content: This was one of the many times I have stayed at Swissotel The Bosphorus in Istanbul. I got a Swiss Executive Sea View Room which is really great , the view in really excellent as well as the service. I asked to have a pillow at 2am in the morning - and here you go after few minutes a great pillow was delivered to my room! All requests are answered promptly and professionally. The Lounge receptionists are very welcoming of guests and they do a real great job. Gaja Roof bar has the best barman and cocktails in town...what an amazing place. It is true rooms need to be renovated , they look a bit dated in terms of decoration and furniture but they are clean and well kept. Rumors are the hotel will start renovating one of the two wings. I really suggest this hotel to anybody who want to enjoy a fantastic town such as it is Istanbul and sample great food & drinks with an outstanding service. Well done Swissotel ...hope to be back for my birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service and perfect for family vacations in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kikaBrussels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really perfect to discover Istanbul s great historic and modern places and combine it with relaxing moments at the Spa.Our daughter loved the outdoor pool and i liked the hamam, the peaceful spa, the in door swimming pool. The service is just perfect, could not be better, the rooms of a good size and perfect organisation. We all enjoyed the view on the Bosphorus! Even though we were on holidays one remark from my working perspective: finally a hotel room, where the bureau is intelligently integrated, so that one has enough space to really work on it. So this is definitly a hotel, which is peefect for holidays as well as for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “I was alone in Istanbul but felt like I was at home at Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: SOBEBUNN
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a place! I must say that I have stayed in many nice hotels but this one is on the top of my list. I went to Istanbul to meet an old friend but as I arrived my friend had to be away for a business trip. So I ended up staying for only 2 nights at the hotel. I was very pleased overall that I chose Swissotel. The lobby and entrance was gorgeous, I would say the views are some of the best in the city. You look out right into a palace and the Blue Mosque is right across the Bosphorus. I chose (upon reading many reviews) to upgrade to the executive level suite that allows you access to the top floor for drinks and food throughout the day. This includes a great breakfast, lunch and snacks for Happy Hour. It was well worth it and the views from the top floor executive level are amazing! Each morning I had a friendly breakfast and my little friend met me on the perch, he was a bird who liked to nibble on my salmon while I enjoyed my turkish coffee. The room was very cozy and came with all of the comforts of home including a view. It had a great shower and marble bathroom, wireless internet, comfortable and soft sheets and bed, minibar, nice adjustable lighting, and a safe for your valuables. I enjoyed looking out the window and seeing the Bosphorus from the other side looking at the bridge....at night it was breathtaking. If you are looking for ultra modern decor it is not that type of hotel but it is elegant in every way imaginable. I felt safe and I felt secure being in a city alone for the first time. There was a conference at the hotel and I got to meet some nice wives around during the day. The gym and spa was really top notch. I took 2 classes with an instructor and the gym itself was complete with cardio machines and weights and weight machines. The people there were on a membership and a nice class of people. I had to meet my friend finally at 8 PM on my check out day so I enjoyed the pool and gym all day long. I had a nice lunch at the pool with a healthy salad and glass of wine, the service was great. The only complaint that I had was that I couldn't go back up to the club level again for Happy Hour since I already checked out. When I checked in it was at 8 PM, which was pretty late so I didn't get to use the club level that first night. I thought I would be able to use it up till the time that I actually checked in but it was not their policy. It was fine though, I enjoyed the spa and gym and they checked my bags safely that entire day. Overall, this hotel exceeded my expectations. The rates are a little less expensive than most of the other fine hotels in the area. I feel that my stay was worth it and my experience was one of a kind! I will return to Istanbul and I would stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay - Excellent fitness centre”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaRos
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a good location close to commercial centre and key attractions. The rooms are in good condition and housekeeping is great. Service throughout the hotel is excellent - staff is well trained, friendly and accommodating. What really sets the hotel apart is its new fitness centre, which is state-of-the art. One of the most pleasant hotel work-outs!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuestSmith
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and kids to this wonderful hotel which was a base for a visit to a conference. We all enjoyed it immensely. It is a really great place and its location on the European side is convenient enough to get to everything worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but there are better”
Reviews.Author: clydethetraveller
Reviews.Content: Ultimately, this is a good hotel, but is outshined by its rivals which offer better service and more up-to-date rooms. Don't get me wrong -- it's not a bad hotel by any means. The Bosphorus view rooms are very large and have great views and an actual desk where you can work. However, the size of the hotel does lead to a somewhat impersonal level of service, but largely, the staff does try. The rooms are not in poor condition by any means -- they just feel outdated. Bathrooms are large and clean, but do not have shower stalls and products are generic hotel brand. For the price this hotel charges, you'd expect more. However, if you can get a reasonable rate, you won't have a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better....”
Reviews.Author: Amit01
Reviews.Content: We had booked online and being Gold members of the loyalty programme were sure of the upgrade and other facilities that come with it. The upgraded executive rooms were nice with a beautiful view but a bit tired and definitely in due need of a renovation which we were told is scheduled. The executive lounge was wow with perfect service and an amazing view of the Bosphorus. The only downside was the indifferent behavior of some of the management team and the unprofessional behavior of the concierge. Overall not a bad place but you have definitely better options for $400/nt in Istanbul....

Reviews.Title: “rooms are lovely, hotel not great but not bad - average 5 star”
Reviews.Author: TobySimkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in a lovely room, with good amenities (great soap on a rope! -- although not replenished during the stay). The hotel itself is a typical 5 star, good location downtown (but still a taxi to anywhere), strong vehicle security to enter the grounds, huge lobby bar/cafe, brand name shopping concourse, clean rooms, english TV, fast (but very expensive) internet [WARNING: Internet is charged PER DEVICE -- so your iPhone, iPad etc.. connecting will triple your bill, in Euros], and good english spoken throughout all staff/departments. Room service was overpriced, but good quality. Tried to attach my Swissotel Gold Points to my stay, but front desk verbally said it was done, but I never received my points. Extended for late checkout due to an evening flight, cost was half day rate.. All in all, a nice clean stay, but nothing too memorable or distinctly bad. Recommended for business travelers needing to be downtown, on an expense account.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience. No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: fdk0603
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 2 kids. We were given a beautiful 3 bedroom, fully equipped apartment, with stunning panoramic views of the Bosphorus. The staff was super friendly, the apartment was spotless, and the service was excellent. Our only complaint was that we were only there for 2 short days.

Reviews.Title: “feel unconfortable with extras..”
Reviews.Author: Carlo S
Reviews.Content: I hv been there several times, both on business trip and leisure or a combination of both. I have been various hotels in Istanbul but Swissotel is among my favourites for winter. Location is so-so as it is difficult to go anywhere but by taxi, while it is true that taxis are not so expensives and a short ride is affordable. Anyway Suissotel is not for you if you are travelling on a budget......I like the feeling when stepping in - gorgeous, astonishing and "grandioso" for the view over the Bosphorous in the right direction that is southeast, more or less. Accomodation in the seaside rooms is a pleasant one and the general feeling is you are getting well from your money. Never experienced a garden room. The really weak point is the price for extras, from beakfast to internet connection, not to mention a brunch or their restaurants where one really does not get what he is paying for. I am never really travelling on a budget but prices are well over a magnificent Tokyo's hotel, without getting really much. I used to read with a kind of "disdain" the reviews mentionning the too high cost for extras as an experienced traveller should know that a five star hotel has a lot of stars also in the additional service prices. However in the case of Swissotel - that I like after all - I had the feeling that I can go there as far as I dont buy anything but the room. So, I may be there again but......beware.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent top class hotel Ideal for business”
Reviews.Author: allwaysonthego
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two night in the Executive level of the west tower with a delightful room overlooking the Bosphorous. everything was of a standard you'd expect for the price, the staff were excellent from the porters to the room service. I cannot compliment them enough. My only gripe given the price is the fact the Internet access is â‚¬19 per 24hours or â‚¬6 for a single hour, which I find given the room rate a bit cheeky. The pool and spa facilities are excellent and a great way to relax. The shirt service is prompt and excellent, which is often overlooked when your on the road travelling for a long time in business. You can bring visitors to the executive lounge on the 17th floor for a more private and condusive athmosphere for business meetings. Overall, i wouldn't bother looking eleswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Superb facility and great service and views”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: Top-rated hotel with great views from the lobby, room and top floor's restaurant/bar on Bosphorus. Outside bar and restaurant are a must even for a quick drink. the view from there is charming. Very convenient lobby so one can grab some small food and/or work or have meetings in a nice setting. Freshly squeezed juices (orange and grapefruit) are top quality. Hotel room impeccable with cool design. Fruit basket in the room - good quality also. Location not the best for tourism (except for views) but convenient for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Business/Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaserati
Reviews.Content: We had a business conference here and were very happy with the level of customer service. Everything was very well organized and thought through. Very nice and clean rooms with breathtaking views. Food (breakfast and lunch) were very tasty. The rooftop bar is a must if you stay here, one of the best bars ever. All together an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fnk1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a business trip in Istanbul. From the outside the hotel looks a bit out of date. However, the room are spacious and refurnished.
