I found the staff friendly and helpful. There is a good choice of restaurants - but beware of high prices. Overall it was a good experience and I would recommend to all business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive, too business, too outdated, unique roof terrace though”
Reviews.Author: PaulOvertoom
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here for business on a regular basis from the opening year (1991) and I happened to stumble upon the 20th anniversary celebration. I remember the hotel as a large, uninteresting pair of towers connected by a large entrance, lobby, bar and breakfast room geared to receive large numbers of guests. The atmosphere is therefore somewhat crowded. As a guest, you feel one of many, may. Nothing much had changed since 1991, except the trees in the breakfast terrace view (larger) and the prices (even more extravagant). The hotel is still frequented by Istanbul's beau monde (tea on sunday, weddings and other society parties). I learned that the interior will be drastically renewed from 2012 and I recognised the need. My suggestion would be to avoid the Swissotel while construction is going on; this might last some time. On the other hand, the staff were friendly and hospitable as always and the roof top terrace may not be missed: it offer maybe the most spectacular view over the old city, the entrance to the Golden Horn, the Bosphorus and the exit to the Marmara Sea. You simply cannot take your eyes off the activity on the water. At night, sit at the front and enjoy an utterly romantic fairy tale scene. Don't drink too much though, otherwise you might need to visit your banker before you ask for the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Only a Business Hotel, Avoid for Holidays”
Reviews.Author: max_d1
Reviews.Content: Swissotel seems to be one of the local favorites for business travelers. We made the mistake of staying there for a holiday with family and must say that it was a very poor choice. The location has nothing to offer (far from all the nice areas of Istanbul, up a hill with nothing of interest nearby), rooms could use an upgrade, all amenities (such as internet which is normally now free in most hotels in Turkey, laundry, room service) are extremely overpriced. We were planning to stay for 4 days but moved after 1 night. Concierge staff was excellent and the rest of the staff were also very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of Bosphorus!”
Reviews.Author: Scoothand
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Swissotel, they were having a 20th year celebration with very loud music until well past 1am, this did not make us happy after traveling all day to get there. With that being said, the hotel's staff was very friendly, and the location is unbeatable! Skip the hotels Japaneese food, as it was awful. Also the hotel was very very expensive, a drink at the hotel bar costs around $25. Also some things are in Euro's some are in Turkish Lira. Hotel WiFi is absolutly overpriced at 6 Euro's an hour. The spa was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Once a pleasant hotel, now in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Onefourall
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a party of it's own shortly after we arrived but they chose not to warn us that we wouldn't be able to use the outdoor pool for 48 hours or that we wouldn't be able to sleep because of the considerable noise and disruption. This is not a cheap hotel and the charming staff are badly let down by the poor management. I have been staying here, on and off, for nearly twenty years and it used to be very well run.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jphansen32
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good located in a large garden. Although being inmidst Istanbul, you can open the window, hear birds singing, breathe fresh air and have a beautiful view into the amazing garden and onto the Bosphorus itself. Most exiting is the roof bar / restaurant from where you have an even more excellent view while receiving very good food, drinks and service. Vety advantage is that you can reach the old town with Topkapi, Blue Mosc and all other attractions by tram. Just take a walk or a quick taxi to the end point of the tram and enjoy riding over the Golden Horn on its own rail not being bothered by any of that really crazy traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, great location...”
Reviews.Author: HelenaMi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for 5 nights (end of April, beg of May 2011.) and would certainly recommend it. GREAT LOCATION - overlooking the Bosphorus!!!! Very friendly, perfect and professional service, great breakfast buffet. Big, clean rooms with all amenities. Great turndown service in the evenings with even bathrobes changed. Worth repeating over and over again ! The view from the bedroom was amazing, same as the view from the top roof restaurant. We really enjoyed the very varied breakfast with delicious local and international taste. We want to go there again and againâ€¦.We love Istanbul and Swissotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service and attitude”
Reviews.Author: Bakuvian
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a very nice hotel, big and convenient. Service is just superb, best of all hotels i have stayed in Istanbul. Everyone was so helpful, smiling and went extra mile to please guests. The food was great, although I ate at the main restaurant only. The only complaint is rooms in east wing which are very worn out; furniture is more suitable for a 3 star. It is disgrace for such a great hotel. The spa was very good, even with a small pool. The location is on the hill, which gives you a view of the bosphorus and relatively clean air. But you will need taxi to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views, gorgeous spacious accommodations and wonderful friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: botrip48
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful expereince at the Swissotel. The President's Club Level rooms are beautiful since you have a grand view of the Bospherous and the Bridge. "The Presidents Club is a great value since your have so many food and drink choices; exotic and western and so creatively displayed. The internet is available all day until 11pm at no extra charge. The spa is huge and amazing. The rerstaurants also have fine staff and the buffet foods are displayed so prettily. The beds are most comfortable. The rooms are large and are equipped with everything you need. The Service was excellent. The newest building next the the hotel has 1 - 2 - 3 bedroom apartments; very modern with their own President's club room with the Bospherous view also. We recommend the Swissotel for your Istanbul stay; short or long. the Shanghai Swissotel is lovely, also.

Reviews.Title: “excellent !!!”
Reviews.Author: claudiac67
Reviews.Content: really the place to stay in Istanbul. perfect, professional and friendly service, great breakfast buffet, beautiful position overlooking the Bosphorus. An oasis of peace in a big garden. Big, clean rooms with all amenities. Great turndown service in the evenings with even bathrobes changed. worth repeating over and over again !

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: XriLou
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, view, friendly staff, luxurius rooms and not only. Close to perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Delighted experience”
Reviews.Author: elsa2011_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location with a very friendly and efficient staff. The view from the bedroom was amazing, same as the view from the top roof restaurant. We really enjoyed the very varied breakfast with delicious local and international taste. I would strongly recommend this place to anyone who has a lot of energy to visit this beautiful city. Kind regards.

Reviews.Title: “A safe hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: babyili
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is neither safe nor dangerous, being the most "European" city of Turkey, some areas of Istanbul can easily scare tourists. However Swissotel the Bosphorus is located in a beautiful and very safe area of the city. The hotel itself is luxurious but not really representing Swiss hotel management. Make sure to book a room with a Bosphorus view it is really worth it!! Thumbs up for the nespresso coffee mashine in the room, thumbs down for consierge, not so helpfull, seemed bored to me. A car service would be really helpful and quite necessary in Istanbul as taxi-drivers are horrible and deceiving. We actually counted ONE GREEN LIGHT during a 20 minutes ride, the rest were all red.... I didn't try the pools or the SPA but I hear they are really good. Breakfast not so good. It is a very very nice and luxurious hotel but not 5 stars....

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful- many extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Type_A78
Reviews.Content: The problem with this hotel is that it has only two kinds of rooms: those that oversee the Bosphorus and those that overlook the park (it is actually a parking lot). If you stayed in a room overlooking the Bosphorus then the view makes it all worthwhile. If you didnâ€™t then it is too expensive. I was here on business and my company has a special rate with the hotel. I had the option of staying elsewhere but the reviews online for this one were very positive so I decided to go with Swisshotel. I guess if you have a company rate then you will get a room overlooking the parking lot. I complained: I was staying for four nights so I tried to get at least two nights with a view but I had to pay extra 40 Euros per night. Only upgrade possible was a higher room overlooking another side of the parking lot. The rooms are comfortable and quiet. There are few Non Smoking rooms so you may have to settle. Location is OK. It is far from old Istanbul and you will need taxis to go there. The other drawback to the location is it is very difficult to grab a bite that is not at the hotel, and while the hotel has many restaurant options, they are remarkably overpriced. Internet is 20 euros per day (and per computer!) and room does not have coffee or tea (you have to pay for both!). Overall, my advice if you are not sure you are getting a room with a view of the Bosphorus then go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Sogoba
Reviews.Content: I am not impressed with the Swisshotel The Bosphorus. The first turnoff was the reception service. I stayed here on business because my company has a special rate with the hotel. The rate is supposed to include breakfast. When I checked in, the guy told me that my reservation did not include breakfast. Luckily I had a printout with me that proved it did. Then when he was assigning the room, I asked for a non-smoking room with a view of the Bosphorus. He told me that for a view, I had to pay an extra 40 euros. I declined because my company would not cover it. So he gave me a room on the 3rd floor. I asked for something on a higher floor, but he told me there were no more non-smoking roooms. One thing you should know is that because it's on a hill, the entrance to the hotel is on the 9th floor. So the 3rd floor was six floors down with a view of a parking lot and nothing else. I went back to the reception and asked for a higher floor, even if a smoking room. The guy told me nothing was available unless I paid 40 euros. But then I asked a young woman at the reception and she magically found me a non-smoking room at the same rate on the 15th floor. This was much better, with a decent view, but it was annoying that the first guy seemed to be misleading me in order to sell me a more expensive room. The location is the best thing about this hotel. It does overlook the Bosphorus, and it's close to the popular Nisantasi shopping area. But it's not in the old city where the main historical sites are located. And I found that Nisantasi contains many shops like Gucci and Armani that you can find anywhere else in the world. The room itself is okay, with a large bed and a small marble desk for working. But in general this hotel is in bad need of a renovation. The decor is not modern, but rather looks like 20-year-old pseudo Ottoman, with fraying carpets and peeling paint. Also, when I arrived the room reeked of cheap room deodorizer, like they were tring to cover some some foul odor. But I could barely breath and had to open a window. The other thing that annoys me about a "luxury" hotel like this is that you pay a lot for a room, but then they still try to squeeze you by getting you to pay ridiculous amounts for using the internet or the coffee machine in your room (if you want, bring your own Nespresso cartridges or tea bags!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: sbk225
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 2 nights. Amazing service, great location, loads of meeting rooms, sleeping rooms are spacious, food is excellent, SPA is so big. Make sure to get your appointment as soon as you check in as they get very busy. if you are checking in early, please let them know in advance or you will be waiting for hours. Hotel is very clean. Courteous staff, shopping arcade and florist and on and on..the views are breathtaking. I am looking forward to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but over priced”
Reviews.Author: anzen
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice facilities, the staff are quite friendly and helpful, but considering its location, the time of the year (cold and wet) I think it was quite overpriced. I stayed for six nights and without taxes the room was about $300 per night. The location is so bad, one night it took us half an hour for the bus to work its way through the traffic to get about 500 metres (I know - we should have walked). Even walking was a challenge. There isn't a direct route to the road that goes past the sea and leads you to anything interesting. You have to either work your way around a busy highway or walk for miles to get to a traffic light. Once you do get down to the bottom, the tram system is cheap and efficient, although its a bit crowded. I would stay again, but at an appropriate rate of around $200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “So perfect, it almost annoys you ...”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelGeek
Reviews.Content: Pre-Valentine week-end booked with fiancÃ© to explore Istanbul, the hotel offers location, service and has it all. Perfect service, superb and friendly staff who always seem to be a step ahead of you when you wan/need something, be it help with luggage, extras for the room, transport etc. It is so perfect, it almost drives you out of your mind. Their breakfast buffet is sumptous, both Continental and Turkish offerings. The Amrita Spa is probably the best I have so far found in a hotel, Turkish Hamam, Salt Stem Room, Sauna, Gym, Indoor and Outdoor Pool, and more.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, choice NÂ°1 in Istanbul, definately”
Reviews.Author: Bea294207
Reviews.Content: We came to a friend's wedding (which also took place at the hotel) and we had the absolut most fabulous time staying at the Swissotel. *Food is great: breakfast buffet is to dream of *Views are breathtaking: I think this hotel has the best view of all Istanbul. We woke up every morning with the most spectacular sunrise on the Asian side, lying in the most comfortable bed! *Rooms are very comfortable, I would advise you to take a room at the end of the corridor where you have a panoramic view on the Bosphorus * service is up to scratch! So what more do you need? If you can afford it, I would definately book at the Swissotel, you wont be disappointed. Thank you so much Swissotel, and especially Yasemine for making our stay so unforgettable

Reviews.Title: “Very nice service, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: HotelImpressions
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in early 2000 when was owned by Japanese, and later with Turkish owner. A huge improvement in service and staff in general. Sunday brunch was a bit chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely bridge side view”
Reviews.Author: bloodplux
Reviews.Content: I suggest you , Bosphorus, bridge side room... Just pay a a little more and enjoy the hotel. It was very nice stay but everything is extra... spa is great....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Arty2011
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in this hotel, and we never regretted about our choice. 1. Supurb view on Bosphorus 2. Good location, 10 minutes walk to Nisantasi district, 15 minutes drive to old city. 3. The staff was 100% friendly and eager to help. Minuses: 1. Rooms and some common areas need considerable renovation even though they are perfectly maintained and it didn't any how influenced our stay 2. Prices for minibar drinks and snacks are very high Ovarall: definately worth staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but I think this hotel needs some renovation”
Reviews.Author: dsw12341
Reviews.Content: Great ambiance, friendly staff, many F&B facilities and spacious room and the most spectacular view of bosphorus. Hotel feels bit old, renovation may be needed. Excellent food selections at their F&B facility such Miyako and Baja. We just found little trick from in house photographer for new yearâ€™s eve. They took 4-5 pictures of us during dinner then before countdown the photographer were chasing us to pay 100 TYL for each photo. Tricksâ€¦ (we never ask them to take pictures but then they forced us to pay, once again tricks)

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Priths
Reviews.Content: Unbelieveable location, overlooking the Bosphorus, on the grounds of the former Dolmabache Palace. Excellent service. Well organized conference.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spa facilities”
Reviews.Author: FamilyofsixSweden
Reviews.Content: A great place to come back and relax in after a long day of sightseeing. The massage etc is expensive but the "free" part of the spa is more than enough. Truly relaxing.... hamam, saunas, rainforest showers, ice shower (!), relaxing water beds, gym, indoor pool, jacuzzi etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs a makeover, poor service, food prices outrageous”
Reviews.Author: DariOlio
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here on business at least 10-12 times. The rooms are dated and the entire hotel needs a makeover. The prices in the bars and rest. are ones of the highest I ever seen (including Russia). Lucky me I was not paying otherwise I would have feeling of being robbed. Service is far away from Swiss level.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Burgsinn
Reviews.Content: First of all,I should state that this Hotel affords its expanded stay visitors no luxuries. When I went to continue my stay I discovered that the Hotel administration was asserting that I could not do so because of the F1 FormulaOne rush in town. I discovered this to be very strange, because before I made the demand I discovered clear accessibility by Expedia - and I discovered that accessibility was plentiful for the designated days they asserted to be completely booked. At one issue after frequently being notified they are positively registered, I booked a room and got confirmation registration by expedia inside a minute afterThey notified me they have no accessibility for. This is very secret to me, as long-term visitors are generally accomodated but not so here at the Swissotel Bosphorus Istanbul.I discovered the Hotel to be very far taken from out-of-doors vendors, needing a cab for you to get any place outside. May be thatswhy they can ascribe you 10 times higher charges for a easy Netcafe coffee they get from Nesprsso Pod machine.I discovered the pool locality to be attractive but its fountain not habitually on when it should have been. The employees was still cleansing the pool at a time when 9:30AM when most other Hotels are prepared for customers. Some of the demeanour of the employees was large and other ones were very unacceptable. Yes it is a pleasant hotel, but the clientele service you'd anticipate from a five star is absent.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service and facility”
Reviews.Author: tansy01
Reviews.Content: Despite being a large hotel, the staff provided very personalized service. Every inch of the hotel is scrupulously maintained. The location may not be ideal for tourists, but for me the views and quiet more than offset the need for a brief walk to the tram. The breakfast buffet is pricey, but you should try it at least once...it's unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great view but far from the city”
Reviews.Author: anaidross
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simply beautiful with wonderful facilities. There is a great hamam in the cellar where you could have a nice bath. It has a wonderful view of the Bosphorus from the roof. The only complain is that the hotel is a little far from the old town. But with such a beautiful hotel, one does not need to get out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite service and surroundings”
Reviews.Author: LAG711
Reviews.Content: Fantastic "business room" with partial view of Bosphorus. Elegant hotel with exquisite service, unbelievable Turkish bath within the most beautiful spa we've ever seen. Candlelit walkways, water fountains, immaculately clean and well appointed with a wonderful staff. Well worth the extra we paid over the public baths. An experience not to be forgotten. The small restaurant/lounge for business room travelers also had a selection of great snacks and delicious coffee and a stunning view of the harbor. Fairly centrally located and on a par with any Ritz I've been in, but less money.

Reviews.Title: “cool and good”
Reviews.Author: latinooo
Reviews.Content: the best swissotel I've been .. Big and trendy and wonderful stay .. for you and your family also ..

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: hortamdp
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay there. Our room was very spacious, the bathroom marbles were very impressive and we had an amazing view of Bosporus. The food was fantastic also. The hotel was quite close to the main entertaining center of the city, Taksim. It was also close to the historic city center, 10 mins by taxi. The staff was very kind and elegant however I would expect to have a higher level of English from them. Hotel's turkish bath must be definitely seen, the best I have ever seen in my life. Our whole stay was an absolutely fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, At a Price”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on my first ever visit to Istanbul. The purpose was primarily business, but with some cultural visits thrown in. The Swisshotel The Bosphorus was selected by Turkish colleagues who organized the trip, and it did not disappoint. This hotel enjoys a great location overlooking the Bosphorus River, and it is well located for both cultural visits and meetings in the city. Taxis are required, but they are easy to obtain. Furthermore, I was told by Turkish colleagues that the taxi drivers serving the hotel generally are trustworthy, and that this is not always true for Istanbul taxi drivers in general. The hotel's facilities are excellent. The are multiple restaurants on the premises, but unless you are squeezed for time I recommend venturing out to experience the restaurants and cuisine of Istanbul. One recommendation is Hamdi, near the Spice Market. The lobby bar and lounge also provides good service, and the fitness center is outstanding. The prices at Swisshotel The Bosphporus are high, but not beyond would you should expect for a Five-Star hotel. And the clientele matches.

Reviews.Title: “Super experience at Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: montemaranne
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 5 days at Swissotel in Istanbul with friends. It was wonderful and we had a fantastic time. I organised the trip because my friends wanted me to show them the sights of Istanbul, which I know quite well. As I had stayed at Swissotel before, it was high on my list of favourites and I certainly did not regret my choice. I booked our rooms on the executive floor with access to the executive lounge on the 17th floor. We spent some time every day on the balcony there just watching the ferries on the Bosphorous below. It is one of the best views in the city in my opinion. Of course I was worried that everything would work out, so I contacted the hotel in advance to make sure our rooms were not near the elevators or roof bar and to arrange a dinner reservation for the first night. Everything was handled very professionally and quickly. Our reception at the hotel was great - we were whisked up to the 17th floor lounge and were in our rooms in minutes. The luggage arrived quickly and we were able to go to dinner right away. Next morning, breakfast in the lounge was good - out on the balcony in the sunshine. The staff were excellent, friendly and courteous. Our rooms were spacious and very clean. The housekeeping staff helped us in every way they could. One morning it rained, so we needed extra umbrellas in addition to the one already provided in the room - no problem - service with a smile. The indoor pool is great for swimming laps. The spa is beautiful with fantastic staff. The outdoor pool is very spacious for a hotel pool and there were adequate loungers positioned around it. Both pools were very clean. Any time we needed a taxi, the doorman was immediately at hand and gave us a card with the taxi's registration number on it in case we forgot something in the car or had any problems. Here I would like to mention the fact that we had no problems at all. The drivers used their taxi meters and were even prepared to drive us a very short distance when it was pouring with rain. I do speak some Turkish so maybe that helped a bit. The concierge was friendly and pleased to make reservations for us, although I chose the restaurants myself (with the help of Turkish friends). All in all, we really enjoyed our visit and I can recommend the hotel to Istanbul visitors. Certainly you have to take taxis to the sites, but Istanbul is so huge that you have to take taxis anyway, so it doesn't really matter which area you stay in. The Swissotel is located in a nice garden - which used to belong to thegrounds of the Dolmabache Palace and it is just a short stroll up to Nisantas with many restaurants and nice shops. It's a nice hotel is a beautiful location. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old-style luxury!”
Reviews.Author: stefi1970
Reviews.Content: I spent with my husband ten days at the Swissotel The Bosphorus and I can only recommend this hotel. Maybe some rooms need a bit of renovation, but everything is extremely clean and offering you the best comfort. We stayed in a Classic corner room on the West Wing: the room is big enough to accomodate two person even for a long staying, with a useful working-table, a spacious closet and plenty of shelves and drawers. The bathroom is a good size, with a spacious marble sink and big mirrors everywhere. Maybe the only negative point is the bathtub/shower, which looks a bit old, is very slippery and let a lot of water on the floor while showering. The room was very quiet at anytime and the housekeeping service one of the best we've ever experienced: always quick, personalized and just perfect. The only minus I could find: Internet connection is not complimentary and quite expensive (6 Euros/hour or 19 Euros/day), and that goes as well for minibar and coffee in-room facilities (there is a nice Nespresso machine but it costs you a fortune to make yourself a coffee!) - I think that at the rate people are paying to stay in this hotel, maybe Internet and a coffee should be offered for free. On the other hand, you get complimentary bottled water in-room and even at the pool. The external pool is really beautiful, surrounded by the old trees of the well-kept garden and with a fantastic view over the Bosphorus. You can enjoy the sun laying in one of the different sunbeds, with towels service and a nice bar-grill where you can have a good meal without leaving the sun. There is as well an inside pool and a great fitness room. We didn't try the SPA but it looks to be high level. The hotel has several different restaurants. We had breakfast at the Swiss Cafe`, offering one of the best choice of buffet breakfast I've ever tried, that you can enjoy from a beautiful covered terrace with a spectacular view. But the best view at all is the one you can enjoy from the top roof bar (16th floors): it can turn a little windy during the night, but it is a great place to enjoy a drink. Maybe a bit expensive, but it certainly worths the price!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, impeccable service, great attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: dsst
Reviews.Content: It was an absolute joy to stay at this hotel. Incredible staff and excellent amenities. The grand airy lobby has an amazing view over the Bosphorus aswell as a fabulous roof top bar & restaurant overlooking the whole of town...incredible! The hotel is very well located in Istanbul with beautifully landscaped grounds which makes it peaceful aswell as being close to the centre of town...Best of both worlds. I would highly recommend Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian_uk12000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a cruise and other than the location which is definitely NOT central it was excellent. We booked online an executive room and got a great rate by paying in advance and upon arrival we were taken to the Executive Lound on the 15th floor. Our check in time was supposed to be 3 pm but they found us a room at 9.30 am. We stayed in the lounge for a light breakfast and then went to the room which was well located with a view of the Bosphorus and our Ship. The Concierge arranged a boat trip for us and it was handled well. Lunch by the Pool was good although the Server's English was not so great. Breakfast the next day was limited and if I had to make one comment it would be that the tables and chairs are meant for drinks rather than meals. The tables were far too low to eat comfortably. A taxi was arranged by the hotel to the Airport and there is confusion over prices. The Concierge quoted in Euros and the doorman told us we could only pay in Turkish Lira. We sorted this out with the Driver and paid him in English Pounds. Overall it was a really excellent hotel and should we return to Istanbul woukd certainly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: strelaura
Reviews.Content: Pros Overall: beautiful hotel with amazing views! We picked this primarily b/c we got a good deal (through hotel website) and we were really surprised at how nice it was. I don't think their website does it justice. Rooms: Huge room, great comfortable bath, awesome bathroom. Only downside, no patio/balcony. We paid for the basic room and it overlooked the pool. For the price you really can't beat it. Plus we got Turkish delights on our pillow every night - nice way to end the day :-) Pool: Awesome pool, comfortable lounge chairs, free water bottles. Cons Distance: You really do have to taxi everywhere. While the tram is easy to use, air-conditioned, and super clean, you can't get to the nearest station by foot. We didn't mind this, but something to consider. Personally we liked being in the new town area - there are much more fun/local restaurants to try out (go to the Tunel district). Old town is great for the day site seeing, but quite spread out and more touristy restaurants. Business hotel: We were warned this was a big business hotel - we saw a mix of people, but honestly most people looked like vacationers. Internet: No free internet - not even in their business center.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel with Great Views and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: DMW1108
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two kids ages 13 and 9) and another family (kids ages 13 and 11) recently stayed at the Swissotel Bosphorus. It was a perfect place to land after a long flight to Istanbul from Canada, via Rome. From the outside, the hotel is not terribly attractive--two high rise towers, with little personality. However, we were immediatley blown away by the view of the Bosphorus from the lobby. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms very comfortable and the facilities excellent. The food was very good, also, and the kids, in particular, loved the variety of the breakfast buffet! There is also a rooftop bar/restaurant with fabulous views of the Bosphorus. The piece de resistance for us, however, was the pool and surrounding gardens. It was the perfect place to decompress for the afternoon we arrived--and for other afternoons, or evenings following sightseeing. It should be noted that the hotel is priced accordingly! The hotel is very conveniently located for visiting Dolmabace Palace (just a 5 minute walk down the hill through the hotel gardens and across the street)., but not so convenient for sights in the Sultanahmet, which requires a taxi or public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hossam111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, everything the cleanness of the rooms, the staff, food almost everything â€¦ I went there with my girlfriend and we enjoyed it. They offer dedicated tourist help, and the most important thing that you feel the privacy in your room â€¦ the room size is good, always clean and the breakfast in the morning is delicious. The views are amazing even though we our room was a normal guest room we didnâ€™t enjoy the Bousphorus view from our room but you can spot it almost everywhere in the hotel from the lobby to the roof terrace to the Swiss cafÃ©. There is rooms with Jacuzzi and bousphour views which we wish to stay in during our next visit, the swimming pool and other health facility is amazing. We enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but watch out for prices and exchange rates”
Reviews.Author: FootlooseBoy
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay and would go back. It is central but quiet and feels secure in a city that can feel a bit nervous given its location. The decor is starting to date and will need some investment soon, but it's not shabby. We had a wonderful view from the 14th floor executive room - from the Euro/Asia bridge to the Sea of Mamara, Topkapi and the Golden Horn - one of the best ever. Ask for it if you're going. BUT don't accept a room affected by the roof top bar - disco music until the early hours. No thanks. Most of the staff were very friendly and helpful - but not in the spa. Their initial rudeness lost them a lot of custom [and a tacky "sorry" gift didn't change our minds]. Also they state prices in Euros but use extortionate exchange rates. Watch out if you're calculating in USD or GBP! The pool is a green oasis in the heart of the European quarter. But for some reason there are insufficient parasols. We were always being hassled by other guests trying to find some shade. Why spoil a great location by penny pinching - get more parasols. These niggles aside, the Swissotel does a good job

Reviews.Title: “Five stars, but some big problems and not quite a 'Leading Hotel of the World'..............”
Reviews.Author: MoodyBas
Reviews.Content: We booked through British Airways Holidays, four nights room only inc. return BA flights seemed a steal at Â£502 per person. What swung this hotel for us was the pool which looked awesome in the pictures and is just as good in reality. Surprisingly, we had found that there were very few hotels with outdoor pools in Istanbul. The Swissotel is a â€˜leading hotel of the worldâ€™ and we expected great things. When we first arrived at the hotel we were very surprised to find an extremely high level of security - this may be because a particularly important person was staying there at that time, but none the less our car was checked for bombs, mirror scanned and the boot opened. On entering the hotel itself we then needed to pass through an airport style security scanner and carry bags were searched - rather pointless given that luggage itself wasnâ€™t! Security guards abound everywhere at this hotel and I think that this is a permanent feature. The hotel is grand in the international style, it looks like it was designed in the late 70â€™s. Marble foyers, super smart boutiques, Bulgari, Van Cleef etc. there are about five restaurants, I think only two were open when we went, this was a disappointment as I had looked forward to the Sushi restaurant. A large roof top bar with excellent views. Awesome spa and the best hotel gym I have ever seen! IMO Too many day passes are sold to day trippers to the pool area and this is at the expense of the hotel guests, feral cats everywhere, which is Turkey I suppose. Prices are five star but not London five star - a cocktail could be had for about Â£15.00, you could eat simply for circa Â£30 a head. The Hotel is a Â£15.00 cab ride from most of the sites and town centre, you could walk it and I wanted to but was overruled! So. Problems. Problem 1. When we arrived from a four hour long flight we were very surprised to be told that we did not have a reservation at the Hotel. We had the paper work to prove it with us. The hotel could find no trace of our booking which had been paid for in full and at first we were asked to sit and have complimentary drinks whilst they investigated. Half an hour went by, head office was called and no booking found - we were getting and going no where. It was obvious that I was going to have to be pro active. We, myself and two of the check in staff, went to the business centre where I downloaded further info and various numbers for BA in the UK. Meanwhile I had to provide Swissotel with the number of BA in Turkey - they called and again could not find the booking. After some time I managed to get through to BA in London and had someone there email Swissotel Istanbul with further details and an agreement to cover the cost of the booking. Only then were we taken to our room. The hotel guys were very pleasant and were very willing to help - it seemed to me that they had been very badly let down by head office, BA confirmed that Swissotel had been made aware of the booking in June. I think what really shocked me and what concerns me is that a less pro-active and perhaps less â€˜ableâ€™ guest would have been left panicking and without a room somewhere in Istanbul. Swissotel seemed to reach an impasse with what they could do to find the booking. Long story short, although there was no apology, we received an upgraded room, wine and chocolates for the bother and without asking. Problem 2. Service is very inconsistent, one minute exceptional and the next bad. The hotel really should address this. You will find waiters chatting and laughing whilst you are waiting to order and then once you have ordered will return to chatting and laughing before finding time to serve you your order. Then you will find a waiter willing to continually re light candles that go out, and provide you with five candles to read by and for whom nothing could be too much trouble. Pool side service varied from appalling to OK - again really inconsistent, on one day you had to go and find someone to order drinks from, on another, a drinks trolley, cool towel trolley and even a towel laying service is provided. My point about inconsistent service is that it may be acceptable in a three star hotel but not in a â€˜leading hotel of the worldâ€™. Problem 3. The open air roof top bar whilst amazing, plays loud thumping music until 0100 - and later I think at weekends, or so I was told. I cant speak for others but it woke me up and kept me awake and I had to telephone the desk about it - three times, it was I am told, turned down, I had to take a sleeping pill. The next day more chocolates and fruit to apologise. BUT I really would much rather have just not been woken in the first place. Management says music is limited to 90 decibels - I donâ€™t know what this is, but for me anything which is loud enough to wake me is too much. If you want peace and quiet I would suggest you check the room you want is not affected by the barâ€™s music. All in all a good hotel. One of the best in Istanbul - if not the best - I donâ€™t know. Very clean, very friendly, very Turkish. BUT we had significant problems in only a four night stay. Ultimately I would stay again but only at a value price. If you pay rack (800 euros for our room per night according to the plaque on the wall) you will probably be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific location and renovations are top notch!”
Reviews.Author: RobHus100
Reviews.Content: Overall delighted that I stayed here and I would recommend strongly. Now, I am not used to a Swissotel being so luxurious; in my experience Swissotel franchise properties are similar to having a 3 series BMW, they are a nice, safe choice but quite uninspiring. However, this hotel firmly bucks that trend and I was really pleased to stay here. Good points - so many that they deserve a fuller mention: - the spa area has undergone a transformation - the changing facilities are top notch and the steam room, chilling room etc have an air of modern luxury. The staff are unfailingly polite, even when they are delayed from closing by a guest (repeatedly, sorry!) having a final shower. The interior pool is a work of art and quite serene. - I spent a whole relaxing Sunday by the very good pool area and didn't feel bored. The pool area and pool itself is resplendent, water not too cold or warm and the Movenpick yoghurt ice creams keep oneself cool. I guess the prices keep the riff raff away and the fellow pool loungers are appropriately polite and friendly. Quite an interesting mix of young, middle aged and young at heart people. Pool lounging varies from the usual flatbed loungers to multiple occupancy structures. - The roof bar and restaurant is styled with a modern twist and the great and beautiful people come to enjoy the magnificent views. - The tennis hardcourts are literally next to the hotel and serviced by a genuinely friendly coach, very nice person. - The young front staff are really pleasant and charming and the hotel does not have a 'stiff' feel to it, probably because all the staff from the bottom up are pleasant. - don't think I spotted any 'uncles and nieces', or 'nieces' looking for uncles during my 2 week stay - The view when entering the lobby over the Bosphorus is simply amazing. Clever use of gigantic wall windows. Congratulations, Mr hotel designer..... Not so good points - Not many bad points to count. - no free WiFi offered to guests. At prices like these and given the proliferation of netbooks, smart phones etc this should be addressed asap. - The food is an excellent standard but it is at eyewatering prices. - Located very close to a popular football stadium, the fooball fans are notoriously loud and passionate (but I didn't notice much noise in the hotel during a match.) - I had one small issue with the telephones but that was resolved by the front desk after I blindsided the pedantic middle aged 'jobsworth' that originally fielded my complaint

Reviews.Title: “Not so great ! Not so good for the prices they have !”
Reviews.Author: maggie27_20
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our room was not ready yet. We waited for 2 hours after which we asked about the status, moment in which we received the keys. I have to say that the reception stuff was very not welcoming at all (one of the persons was talking with us and looking at his colleague), except for one gentlemen at the Concierge. We roomed around until we found our room (big hotel) as nobody could guide us to the room. After 1 hour we received the luggage in the room and after 2 previous phone calls. About the internet??!!! It is charged 6 euro/ hour or 20 euro/ day, or...... In 2010, a 5 star hotel to charge the internet is absolutely outrageous. By the way one day the internet card costed 12 Turkish lira, the next day was 12,50 lira. Funny, ain't it? The parking fee is 10 euro/ night and so on, you have the feeling that they want to charge your soap as well. The hotel is old, the same as the furniture in the rooms, in our bathroom the water was going almost intro the room at some point. One night we got up in the middle of the night because there were 2 Saint Bernards barking outside , thx God we were at the 7th floor ! I don't know what happened to the neighbors below. The good parts: everything related to the Spa (fabulous, fabulous, fabulous), pool, cleaning services, breakfast (super super good) and very nice stuff, doormen, the daily water, Turkish delight and info for the next day (weather, bla bla) brought in the room as surprise and the view (that made us feel good), as we had a Bosphorus Corner Room. Take hair conditioner with you as there is none provided. To be v. honest at hundreds of euro/ night I was expecting at least to have free internet, to park my car for free and to get some hair conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DELETE1642
Reviews.Content: I had the best time . Nice room, friendly staff, . It has a great location too, . Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning and service oriented hotel. What a reprieve at the end of the day.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler610
Reviews.Content: Swissotel was such a great stay perched utop a hill with a movie-screen size lobby window overlooking the Bosphorus. The enormous lobby was decorated in a classic, and beautifully timeless neutral theme. The service was exceptional. The food, though pricey, was great too as they had something for every nationality for that all important breakfast to get you going for the day. The spread was just amazing. They must have had at least 4 places to eat on the premises--all with views too beautiful to capture w/pics. The surprise at this hotel was the rooftop bar/cafe overlooking all of Istanbul--basically a 360 view. It had "umbrella sails" during the day which made you feel like you were on a cruise ship--w/multi-tiered areas, and a DJ at night in the beautiful "blue" bar area. The other cafes felt as though you were atop or amidst the trees. . Always an incredible view. The rooms were comfortable & spacious enough, though the beds throughout our trip through Turkey and Greece were all so hard...wish they'd do something about that. The concierge outdid himself as we had some bothersome mailings to do, but he accommodated us graciously. Great recs on restaurants too. The location of this hotel is a few minutes' walk downhill to the ferry & bus area, but you may be cabbing quite a bit anyway as so many sights are spread out in Istanbul. It really didn't matter where we stayed as there are several means of transportation at every intersection it seemed. At the end of the day, after sight-seeing in beautiful and exotic (though polluted) Istanbul, it was heaven to get back inside the doors of this relaxing hotel. We would have liked to have just hung out more at the pool and 4-star spa there if time had permitted us. I highly recommend this hotel--wish I had more pictures to show.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid as always..”
Reviews.Author: SongulA
Reviews.Content: Swissotel the Bosphorus the best Hotel to stay in Istanbul.. I simply LOVE Swissotel and recommend everyone with no doubt ! It's just Perfect and magnificent .. Enjoy Cheers Songul AKKABA DHL GF

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: sevil_selcuk
Reviews.Content: Swissotel should be visited because of qualified service and experinced staff. during my stay, I really enjoyed and rested. thank you for all.

Reviews.Title: “it was excellent”
Reviews.Author: 293974Shir81
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Sales team had orginised us a great weekend at swissotel bosphorus. We enjoyed very much. Everything was very detailed and organized. They were perfect. I am from Deutsche Bank, my clients always stay at 5 stars hotel but trust me the best one is Swissotel Bosphorus.Ä± will always recommend only Swissotel Bosphorus... I want to thank Sales team and to your hotel. I hope to stay there again very soon...

Reviews.Title: “A minibreak at the hotel alone”
Reviews.Author: Kentish
Reviews.Content: If location for sightseeing is not an issue, this is a great choice. More of a "holiday" feel than a usual city hotel, with good grounds, pools and wellness facilities where you want to spend time at the hotel itself, not only in Istanbul. Appreciated nice touches, such as ice lollies and cold towels from the sunlounger staff and attentive service for drinks/snacks/setting up towels on a lounger. I was in a cabana room - lovely to have own terrace, but stray cats trying to get into my room if the door was open not ideal. Great to see free Nespresso in the room (compared with the Movenpick Istanbul which doesn't). Lively outdoor bar up on the roof recommended also. Less formal/grandiose than the Kempinski. If you're in Istanbul and want to relax as well, a good solid hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Service should be better for a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iamwherenow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference and from the beginning things were not so smooth. My room wasn't ready when I arrived so I wanted to use the business center but found out that it was closed because it was a Sunday which came as a surprise to me. In any case, I was advised to wait in the executive lounge and used the computer there to do work until my room was ready. I was told someone would come let me know when the room was ready but no one did so after an hour plus I went to the front desk and got my room key. Unfortunately it took over an hour for my bags to arrive after that and when they did arrive I was told "sorry, it's mother's day, so we are busy". I had just arrived on an overnight flight and by this time was feeling pretty gross. While staying at the hotel I was sick and it was impossible to call and talk to a concierge so I ended up having to go wait in line to speak to someone to get medicine. When the medicine arrived at my room I asked the staff to wait to see if there were instructions in English and he said there would be but when I opened the box the directions were in Turkish only. Again, I had to go up to the concierge and wait in line to get them translated. It was small hassles like this that added up and made the stay not as pleasant as I would have wanted it to be. The hotel's location is a bit isolated so you have to like to walk or take taxis to get around town, but it is quiet and the views of the Bosphorous are fantastic. The breakfast was the same every single day for a week and more variety would have been nice. The rooms are large but not very elegant. Overall I found this to be a decent hotel but I don't think it deserves a five star rating, more like three for the quality of service and the amenities offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock104
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to stay here and I was not dissapointed! Despite there being a major conference on at the hotel, the staff were very attentive and friendly. I had absolutely no complaints at all. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing lodging and eating experience!”
Reviews.Author: Gebert
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is a very convenient hotel. Perfectly located with a nice view to the Bosphorus and with an easy access to the shopping area and great restaurants. Service is superb; they welcome the guests very warmly. The hotel offers an amazing gourmet experience with excellent food and restaurants with an incredible view over the sea. The breakfast is also out of this world, with a huge variety, beautiful restaurant with a very high celing and very lively ambience. Plus, they have an acredited huge spa with all types of imaginable treatments. This hotel combines a relaxed and informal environment with first class service and accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “AFFORDABLE LUXURY”
Reviews.Author: Greek_sunseeker
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the hotel.Stayed there for 3 nights on May 6th-9th,Room was sea view ,spacious with all the amenities required. Enjoyed the indoor pool and gym every day as well as the sauna,hamam facilities which are free of charge for the guests. Room service was fast and courteous and the ''loukoum'' each nite was a nice touch . Security in and out of the hotel was also very strict which made you feel secure. Overall it was a great experience and we would definetely return. Only thing missing was night entertainment as the bars were empty and pretty expensive.Gaja restaurant was also closed during our stay which was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star without a doubt- just a bit far from the sites”
Reviews.Author: travellingcpl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 all the way. My only complaint would be that it is far from the main sites, so if you want to have easy access to walking to sites this is not the hotel. That being said in every other department this hotel gets a 5 star. Great spa and facilities, wonderful staff, lovely big rooms. Pure luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Catered to our every need”
Reviews.Author: demars
Reviews.Content: I was put into a Premier Suite with an incredible panorama view over the Bosphorus. The room was very clean, spacious, and comfortable. The staff throughout the hotel (reception, concierge, cleaning, restaurants, meeting rooms, doormen, taxi stand, bell) were all very friendly, sincere, and seemingly happy in doing their work. All were professional and attentive. The hotel is large and has multiple facilities which met our business and personal needs superiorly well. Within my room, the price for internet was MUCH TOO EXPENSIVE at 19Euro per day, or 117Euro per week. Considering the price of the rooms already, I would expect internet service to be included or at least only moderately priced. While complimentary bottles of fresh water were put in my room daily, the prices within the minibar were beyond expensive (18Turkish Lira/9Euro for small canister of Pringles or sparkling water). Also, I was a little shocked to pay 20Lira/10Euro for a bottle of San Pellegrino with a room service dinner. With the exception of these obvious for-high-profit prices, I have only compliments for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous”
Reviews.Author: pandaIstanbul
Reviews.Content: our room and service was wonderful with the Bosphorus wiev my husband and Ä± had a beautiful 2 days, great staff , absolutely the best!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: UniqueTraveler1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there back in February 2010 and we had an amazing stay. The actual hotel was slightly outdated, but the staff and service more than made up for any fading paint. Nothing was too much trouble. Everyone was friendly, helpful and happy--a sign that the hotel is run well! We would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “No Road Is Long With Good Company”
Reviews.Author: Faezeh85
Reviews.Content: That was fantastic. I never felt I'm a foreigner. The hotel staffs were friendly. Services were on high quality and that was one of my best travel ever.

Reviews.Title: “5 Starts hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Hietham
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights, got a room with an amazing view of the Bosphorus, hotel is very nice and fancy, breakfast is great and the staff are very friendly. The gym and the swimming poll are nice. One small problem is to reach the nearest metro station (Taksim) or to go the city center Taksim you need to walk up and downs to reach it, not easy when you come back with some shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Best recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedNorway
Reviews.Content: My dear wife and I went to Istanbul for a 3 days stay ay Swissotel. A perfect choice! Everything was smooth, quiet and above what can be expected even from a 5 star hotel. We had a good price for a room with Bosphorous view and had superb breakfast (even with champagne for myself..). Be aware of the hotelsÂ´ bar and lobby prices, far above Norway!! The concierge gave good advice on nearby restaurants and we enjoyed the life in Istanbul. We limited are "main visits" to the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and to a strait cruise with Turyoul ( YTL9 , 1,5 hour). We enjoyed the pavemenst cafes, however not a bandit taxi driver...). Perfect hotel if you want the best place to stay with your beloved!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Weekend !”
Reviews.Author: Velis
Reviews.Content: With my wife we spend last weekend there celebrating our 17th wedding anniversary. That was one of the best weekends of our life. We were upgraded to a Swiss Corner Room with Bosphorus view. The room was magnificent. The view (180 degrees window) was impacable. You had Bosporus in your feet, boats and ships were passing by and you could stay for hours laying at your King Size bed relaxing and looking outside... Executive lounge was excellents so was the breakfast we had there and of course the evening drinks and snacks. Again the view was breathtaking. Their SPA, facilities and their personalised customer service were outstanding. Looking forward to go back and I want to thank Customer Service and all Hotel staff for this great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than great”
Reviews.Author: ajcJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Rate it with the Fairmont and the Four Seasons. Service was excellent and they could not be more helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular weekend in Swissotel The Bosphorus, Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: sunflower034
Reviews.Content: The weekend I spent at Swissotel The Bosphorus, Istanbul was one of the best times I had in my life. Although it is right in the middle of Istanbul, I felt as if I was far away from the chaos of the city and it gave me a sense of relief. The hotel welcomed me with great hospitality throughout my stay and I had the chance to meet wonderful and various kinds of tastes. The highlight of this weekend was the Bali Deep Relaxation massage I had at the Amrita Spa & Wellness center, followed by the Turkish Bath, sauna and a relaxation sÃ©ance on the special water beds listening to the sounds of the rainforest. I would like to thank the Swissotel crew for a spectacular weekend. I highly recommend everyone to come and experience this wonderful treatment.

Reviews.Title: “excellant stay with panaoramic istanbul view”
Reviews.Author: liege21
Reviews.Content: Even though we are a turkish familiy living in Istanbul, we really love to stay at different hotels. Swissotel is our favorite since very long time. This weekend was my husband's birthday and our weeding anniversary. So we went to Swissotel The Bosphorus with our 1 year old baby girl. They upgraded our room to a panoramic bosphorus view suite. They even put some baby shampoo and baby body cream to our bathroom. (This kind of detail is very important when you stay in a 5 star hotel) The service was excellant, the staff was perfect as always. We were also very satisfied with the "Amrita Spa" , the massages terapistes were great. We really recommend Swissotel the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Way to end a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Texan_10
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful cruise around the Greek Islands and Turkey, my husband and I checked into this hotel to spend an extra day in Istanbul and get a good night's sleep before a long flight home. It was a horrible experience. First of all, our room was seemed to be in the basement with a view of some shrubs. Then we were awakened in the middle of the night by barking dogs, which turned out to be two Saint Bernards residing at the hotel. The management tried to quiet the dogs to no avail. We were eventually moved to another room in the middle of the night, but it was too little, too late.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous stay at the Swissotel Bosphorus for New Year”
Reviews.Author: francoisel
Reviews.Content: We've been in Istanbul for 5 days in Istanbul end of 2009. We've reserved the Swissotel for this stay. And it was the best idea we had! The Christmas decoration was gorgious (many lights outside, a very big christmas tree and a candy house in the lobby, red flowers everywhere). We've reserved an executive room wich was very spacious with a marvelous view of Bosphorus and palaces. The executive floor (17st) had nice snacks the all day, a very tasty breakfast and a wonderful terrace facing Bosphorus. The staff was absolutely friendly and efficient. We don't have something negative to say! Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of location and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: hotelfanfamily
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay at the Swissotel in Istanbul in October, for the first time accompanied by our 5 months-old daughter. We had a very warm welcome by friendly and helpful staff and found our room perfectly well prepared to suit the needs of our baby girl. Our room was very quiet and offered a magnificient view of the Bosphorus. One night we treated ourselves to dinner in the Gaja restaurant, whilst our daughter was look-after by a professional babysitter provided by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: laloli
Reviews.Content: We have stayed three nights at the Swissotel in Istanbul in autumn and we were truly impressed by the employeeâ€™s dedication to deliver friendly and quality service. We were well looked after from arrival to departure and our room was offering a stunning view of the Bosphorus. One of the highlights was the dinner we had in Gaja restaurant. Because of the good weather they were still serving on the roof terrace and we had a chance to enjoy fresh grilled fish form the local waters.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable time at the Swissotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AlphaBasel
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a spacious suite with an amazing view we really had an unforgettable time at the Swissotel in Istanbul. Even though it is quite a large hotel, service is at a high level an anticipates your needs. The facilities available correspond to what you would expect from a Leading Hotel of the World (restaurants, bar, spa, pool etc).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: Klaus_SWalldorf
Reviews.Content: Realy impressing all over the years for keeping the high level of service quality and keeping the host happy. One of the best reastaurants in the town - best swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Hillme
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Swissotel Istanbul because we had a corperate rate there. I mentioned on the reservation stage that it will be my honeymoon. When we entered the room, a cake and a sparkling wine was waiting for us with a note from the management. It was a nice touch. We came very late and we had the time to enjoy the hotel the next afternoon. I and my wife had a treatment in their Spa. We booked the private hammam and it was an experience. The hammam was a combination of both the tradition and the modern architecture. The therapists were very kind and professional. We did not want to go out of the hotel and we decided to eat in house. We were at the japanese restaurant and I had my first tapenyaki experience. The food was excellent. The next day we asked for late check out and the reception supervisor was very kind and gave us a lte check out till 15:00 free of charge. I wish we will come on our wedding anniversary next year.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Bosphorus scene”
Reviews.Author: yalnizbayan
Reviews.Content: Our company is working with Swissotel for 5 years for our crÃªme de la crÃªme clients and we are really very very satisfied . Especially , we are very happy with Ms Didem AkkoÃ§ and appreciate her kind aida..

Reviews.Title: “Average to Good Hotel ,,, BUT !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cooolali
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an average hotel with good view of the sea front. The best view one could get if staying in the right hand tower and the room is to the right hand side of the corridors where the view will encompass the sea and the old city. Most rooms are sea view but it was tricky about the corner room that is over priced but pretty much same as the others with bigger windows to view the Bosphor and few feet larger. The hotel staff was pretty professional and attentive. The two major negative points to highlight to other visitors are: a) the hotel location is good but not in close proximity to restaurants so reliance on Taxis is pretty much what's going to happen for any movement. b) the prices of the hotel services, other than the room, are very high. In any standard, the prices of the food, internet, coffee in the reception were extremely high, I would say the highest I ever paid in a hotel (and I fly a lot). Telephone calls were drastically outrageous from the room. I was lucky to save myself by asking the call charges. Hint, call charges double every next minute according to hotel policies (first minutes to Bahrain is about 11 Lira, 2nd minute 24+ and third was 45+) If one should select this hotel for his or her visit, please be aware of these two major points.

Reviews.Title: “Stupid Food Policy”
Reviews.Author: r_h_Toronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. Our overall stay was ok, but it was ruined on the last night. We had been out and about and had bought some pastries and local delicacies from a nearby bakery. Coming into the hotel, we were spotted by an employee who insisted on taking the food and throwing it away! She said that food from outside the hotel is prohibited because it may be "poisoned"!!! We were in a hurry and did not have time to make a scene, but she managed to rudely confiscate our food. I am pretty well-traveled person, and I have NEVER EVER heard of a policy this retarded. You can always eat your "poisoned" food outside the hotel, and carry the germs with you inside. It is not the "poison" they are worried about. It is just a way to force visitors to limit their choices to what to the hotel has to offer. Which happens to be ridiculously expensive in comparison to other five star hotels around the world (breakfast buffet for about $70 per person, compared to a maximum of $50 in the Four Seasons Toronto). It's their bottom line that matters in the end. I am shocked at the uncivil and illogical behavior of the hotel's staff and how they dealt with the few pastries that had intruded their property.

Reviews.Title: “great view and location but renovation needed”
Reviews.Author: cakil
Reviews.Content: The restaurants and the quality of the foods and services were excellent but the whole hotel and the rooms are looking tired and really need a renovation. The spa was fantastic especially the turkish hamam. The location is great with the whole bosphorus view and nearness to the favorite places.

Reviews.Title: “perfect combination”
Reviews.Author: mrnoor
Reviews.Content: perfect combination of swiss and turkish hospitality, excellent staff specially front desk and concierge. new spa , probably one of the best in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: sebnem75
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Ä°stanbul has the most beautiful scenery of Ä°stanbul. Due to being close to the city center of Istanbul's night life or shopping centers can be found from the shortest path. Also the restaurants and the experienced staff will serve you all the time with their best. This hotel is highly recommended to all !

Reviews.Title: “One of the most pleasurable experiences in Instanbul. A great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Coletane
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Istanbul for over 25 years. I have stayed at a few different hotels during that time period. I find the Swissotel superior to all of them. The location is superb. The food is exceptional. The service is top notch. I intend to always stay at the Swissotel. I come to Turkey 3-4 times per year and I find the hotel one of the most pleasurable experiences about the trip.

Reviews.Title: “one of our unforgettable stayings ...”
Reviews.Author: happyIstanbul
Reviews.Content: swissotel has one of the most spectacular views in Istanbul , you feel just relaxed and happy when you are in the hotel and after... and all the hotel staff working so hard to make your stay memorable. In summer we had great time in pool , in wealth center, in Cafe Swiss , in Gaja Roof and no wonder in our room :))) What can I expect more??

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel Boat 2 Dinner / Logitech”
Reviews.Author: ayerebakan
Reviews.Content: Dear Sir or Madam ; I would like to thank you yor best quality of service and the execuitve sales representative AyÃ§a Ã‡ivgin who is extremly helpful and very kind . Best Regards Ahu Yerebakan Strateji TanÄ±tÄ±m

Reviews.Title: “Greatest 40th birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: alafarina
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 40th birthday with my family and my friends at the Swissotel The Bosphorus. This was the greatest birthday celebration ever. SPA was great, food was excellent and the hotel has the best Bosphorus view in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Perfectionism”
Reviews.Author: Ucko
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel with my husband again for a romantic weekend escape in our home town. Yes, this is a very expensive hotel, however, it deserved every penny. The rooms are spacious, nicely decorated, with all that you might need in a hotel room, those like the one we stayed in, with Bosphorus view are fabulous. There are many restaurant options from international cuisine to japanese. We tried Swiss Chalet, famous for its fondue and enjoyed it a lot. Breakfast buffet is offering a lot of options. Room service is very high quality. As we were there towards the end of winter, we did not enjoy the swimming pool, we were hoping to get some relaxation at the spa which was closed due to renovation unfortunately. But despite these, we loved the hotel, the personnel and the atmosphere.... By the way, though they are all expensive (however not expensive because they are in this hotel, these brands are expensive all around), the boutiques in the shopping arcade are also to be visited. Especially Urart, which is a jeweller famous for antique designs, must not be missed. I attended many business meetings, weddings and graduation balls in this hotel as well, in all of which, I obtained the same perfect impression.

Reviews.Title: “ROMANTIC, COMFORTABLE, LOVELY....”
Reviews.Author: barbacan
Reviews.Content: It was amazing night for me, because I need to get rest after very tiring summer and year, I never think about to stay another hotel for that. I just decide and stay:)) Swissotel is always friendly, comfortable, romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel the Bosphorus is one of the best hotels in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: sede
Reviews.Content: We have been in Swissotel the Bosphorus several times which has an outstanding Bosphours view and an excellent location. The famous Dolmabahce Palace is in a walking distance and Taxim Square, the main centre of the city is just a couple of minutes by car. Swissotel has a very nice and helpful staff. Swisscafe is one of the top 10 locations in Istanbul for brunch and open buffet dinner. They have an excellent spa and health club and a wonderfull open door swimming pool. For sure Swissotel the Bosphorus is one of the best hotels in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievale”
Reviews.Author: radwan199
Reviews.Content: it is atop place from when you step into the hotel the staff are excellent and very helpful the hotel itself is glorious make sure you stay in a room with a view of the water it is worth every cent you spend

Reviews.Title: “The Amrita Spa was great and a beautiful outdoor swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Mariannez
Reviews.Content: When we arrived on a late rainy Tuesday evening we checked in quickly and were guided to our garden view room,large but very business like so we asked for a nicer room with better view and outdoor space. We immediately got a beautiful cabana room with outdoor seating and adjacent to outdoor garden pool and on the same floor as the Amrita Spa and Fitness..It felt so much better and less formal and made us feel being in Istanbul! Service and staff were excellent,friendly and very helpful.. Definitely recommended when you are travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Bosphorus Views”
Reviews.Author: VivekH
Reviews.Content: While not on the waterfront, Swissotel has great views of the Bosphorus and is a modern, chic hotel. Pricey but classy. A bit distant from the main sights of Istanbul though, but it makes for a quieter experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: BeanoSurrey
Reviews.Content: I can't praise this hotel enough - even though I'm already a fan of the Swissotel chain, The Bosphoros is now possibly the best hotel I have ever stayed in. From when you first walk in through the entrance and look out onto the Bosphoros through the large panoramic windows, you get the feeling of being somewhere special. The staff are among the friendliest and most helpful I've ever come across, always willing to help and always with a smile. The room I had was spacious and well furnished even though it was a standard room - flat screen TV, mini bar, coffee machine, comfortable bed, all you'd expect from a hotel of this quality plus a good size bathroom. The staff even turn your bed down whilst you're out in the evening and leave small chocolates and a news sheet about the following days weather, attractions, etc - it's just one of the many things that make this hotel so nice and makes you feel a valued customer There's a well equipped fitness suite (which is free to use) and this has a reasonable size swimming pool, sauna, steam room plus you can choose to pay for various treatments - there's even an outdoor pool for when the weather hots up The hotel has several places to eat but special mention has to go to the Executive Lounge - the views from here are stunning as it's on the 17th floor so I'd certainly recommend taking a look there at least once. Though not a restaurant/bar, it's a nice place to sit and relax and breakfast is served here in the morning - there's also tea/coffee in the afternoon plus refreshments in the evening. .Some people criticise the high price of the food/drink in the hotel but this is no different from any top hotel and given the number of restaurants and bars that are easily accessible from Taksim Square ( a 2 minute cab ride away) then you can avoid paying the hotel's prices - even so, all the restaurants in the hotel seemed very nice though I didn't eat in any myself. Istanbul is an easy city to get around and the tram at Kabatas, which will take you into the main attractions at Sultanhamet is a 5 minute walk away whilst Istiklal Cad, which is off Taksim Square, has numerous restaurants and bars running off it and is only a short (and cheap) taxi ride away. As mentioned, I can't praise this hotel high enough and it certainly helped to make mine and my traveling companion's holiday all the more enjoyable and I certainly look forward to returning to Istanbul and The Swissotel Bosphoros

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Turki_Saad
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 night at room 614 east tower. the hotel is very nice and the staff are very helpful. it would be good advantage of it if they are operating shuttle buses to Sultan Ahmet Area and to Taksim area like any 5 stars hotel. the biggerst disadvantage of this hotel is the over priced internet service. i mean who is still charging for the WIFI these days !

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Accomodation Option in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: taciser
Reviews.Content: Swiss Hotel is the most amazing hotel in Istanbul. The Location being in the city center, most beatiful sight of Bosphorus, and with an amazing garden makes the hotel in the best place of my choice. Although being in city center it is away from traffic jam and the noisy crowd of the city. Also the variety of its restaurants ,delicious foods and amrita spa increases Swiss Hotel's cedibility . Also I am so confident to accomodate with my customers.

Reviews.Title: “Service was exceptional and the view was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: lafa08
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The service was excellent and all the staff were friendly and helpful. We were upgraded automatically to a better room on arrival. The view from the executive lounge overlooking the Boshphorus is amazing. The breakfast was exceptional. We ordered room service and did not get a chance to eat the food before it got cold so we asked them to re-heat, but for hygiene reasons the staff offered to give us a fresh order without any additional cost. The turkish hammam experience was excellent. My wife was not satisfied with her pedicure treatment and the manager offered us a generous discount of the bill to make up for this. The only recommendation would be that the internet should be free in the lobby and/or more reasonable rates for usage in room.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel that could do with a couple of little tweeks to make perfect”
Reviews.Author: madahtims
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel with amazing facilities. Good position. Could do with looking at the price for Breakfast and drinks in lobby. Staff efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Superior wedding anniversary facing the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: MathewErello
Reviews.Content: It was our 9th wedding anniversary, although we did not ask for it and were not in expectation of a surprise, a nice bottle of wine coupled with heart shaped cakes were sent to our room, which has made our night even more special. The room was facing the Bosphorus from above, which makes the view more colorful and rich as compared to staying right at the Bosphorus side. Our east-side corner room had a view starting from the Blue-Mosque and ending with the Bosphorus bridge. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: fionadivaFarnborough
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights after a trip to Yalikavak, in the South. We arrived at the hotel early evening and had a room in the Executive Wing. This gave us access to the executive floor and a slightly larger room. Our room was large, double bed, chaise lounge, desk etc. Coffee machine (although they never left more than one tea bag and one coffee pod with us??) Flat screen tv and Bose sound system to stick i-pod in. We also got shown a fax machine which I guess may be useful to someone on business. Didn't really check out the mini-bar as it seemed expensive in comparison to prices we had been used to paying on rest of our hols 6tl (approx Â£2.60) for a small bottle of water. However it's fair to say we did get 2 complimentary bottles each day. First night we ate at the Japanese/Chinese restaurant as we fancied something different. Very mediocre and I wish we had stuck to Turkish. The Turkish restaurant in the grounds is superb and I can highly recommend it, the staff were lovely and food delicious. Breakfast was simple, pastries and fruit which I was surprised about for the executive lounge. Views of the city and Bosphorous were lovely to look out of whilst eating. The pool area is good, plenty of loungers for everyone and the staff friendly and lay out towels etc. My best recommendation of the hotel has to be the spa. I had one of the best swedish massages I have ever had. The facilities were superb and the changing area, steam room, sauna etc very nice. My husband had a typical hammam massage/scrub and said it was excellent. The hotel location was good for us. We walked out of the hotel and down the hill to the trams. Turkish taxi drivers are nuts and if you value your life I really would recommend using the tram to all the visiting sights. The trams are also kinder on the pocket. We found a reasonable deal on the web for this hotel, which I could highly recommend. I don't think I would want to have paid any more for it.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: On_your_way_SAOPAULO
