Reviews.Content: I stayed at Swissotel for a couple of nights last week, and I was very suprised during my stay. The hotel's location is great, they have a very friendly staff in the restaurant and in the spa (which is amazing). A highlight definitely is the restaurant in the TOP floor with an outstanding view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “All hotels should be like this”
Reviews.Author: Washington28
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a wonderful holiday in Istanbul staying at the Swissotel executive rooms. Our rooms were large and very comfortable and the best feature of all was the panoramic view of the bosphorous from the blue mosqe all the way to the spectacular bridge at Ortakoy and beyond. Our room gave us access to the executive lounge where we had a delicious breakfast, internet access, buffet snacks and soft drinks available all day and alcoholic drinks (and of course more snacks) served between 6 and 8pm -all of this complimentary. Although we were out for most of the day and didn't use this service as much as we could have done, we usually made it to the "happy hour" to have a drink early evening. We usually got a seat outside on the terrace. As the hotel is set on a hill, most of its views are good but none so breathtaking as watching the sunset over the bosphorous from this very high roof terrace. The hotel in general was very pleasant and very well run. The pool area was never too crowded and included towel service and water served by an attendant in an ice bucket. My teenage son used the gym on a few ocassions and was very impressed by the facilities. I couldn't fault the service - it was always friendly and helpful. Although most of the reviews I had read about this hotel were very positive, one questioned the rooms calling them old and tired. I have to say that although the rooms are not modern in design, they are extremelly comfortable and we found them charming - the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in and all the amenities offered worked well. Another criticism I read was concerning extra charges and being charged for the nespresso service in the rooms as well as other charges being very expensive. This was not our experience as the nespresso service was complimentary - possibly this has changed - and we ordered room service and pool-side service a couple of times and found the rates very reasonable - they compared quite favourably with prices at local restaurants. When we payed our bill there were no hidden charges. Perhaps the highest praise for this hotel came from my partner, for whom the trip was a birthday surprise. Although he is not easily impressed he did say at one point "All hotels should be like this." and I can't help but agree.

Reviews.Title: “Best anniversary ever”
Reviews.Author: Duckaustria
Reviews.Content: Our anniversary of wedding was excellent. The view to the bosphorus from the restaurant Gaja und in the room was unbelievible. The deserts in the room were a very kind gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect view in a perfect hotel in a perfect city”
Reviews.Author: MauriceBakker
Reviews.Content: All the thumbs go up for this hotel, as it offers a fantastic and unmistakenbly fantastic view over the Bosphorus. The staff is more than friendly, services are all impeccable and the hotel's own taxis offer clean, well-services and safe taxis at normal rates. And that is not always the case in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The place which you can definetly find the best service in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: izi3
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for somewhere to stay in istanbul which is luxury and unique, which has a wonderful scenery and confortable rooms, which has the most friendly employees and good quality service, please stop wasting your time, you are at the right place at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “best pleasure money can buy in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: arhanvural
Reviews.Content: Even we live in Istanbul staying in Swiss Hotel the Bosphorus was like a new trip to Istanbul. Excellent view of Bosphorus and Istanbul. All the hotel staff made us feel special - thanx. I highly recommend 15th floor - room 1501.

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: trvlgypo
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Swissotel. The hotel has an ideal location in Istanbul with some of the most breathtaking views of Istanbul and the Bosphorus sea. The staff is very polite and attentive. The rooms are very comfortable, very well maintained, and best of all come with a Nespresso machine. Daily turndown comes with a little packet of yummy Turkish delight. the daily breakfast buffet is very popular and for good reason...the food tastes great! The hotel is conveniently located in the Besiktas area which means you are no more than 10 or 15 minutes away from everything you want to see in Istanbul. 5 minutes away are the areas of Nistantasi for shopping, cihangir for cute cafes, Ortakoy for a good seafood lunch and gorgeous views of the Bosphorus....etc. A huge part of my enjoyment in Istanbul was the comfort of staying at the Swissotel. Don't forget to check out their new rooftop bar/llounge. A great way to enjoy the city lights. Great DJ too. Oh and apparently their gym facilties are fabulous, and complimented with both an outdoor and indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling Paradise on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: Zuzuist
Reviews.Content: Wonderful view, maybe the best in Istanbul.. Excellent food.. You can smell the fresh fruits at the time you entered into the breakfast room.. Always wonderful choices of flowers all around the hotel.. All the time, a smiling face and a compassionate voice even if you call them at 3 o'clock in the morning! They always think your best! They even change the type of the flowers in the lobby if you have any allergic or so.. You should experience this..

Reviews.Title: “Great execusion of entire event”
Reviews.Author: Wechselberger
Reviews.Content: Especially the assistance of the sales department, in person by Ece Kaptanoglu, made this event to a big success. Her flexibility, availabilty and professionalism were the foundation of this event.

Reviews.Title: “Best weekend with my husband”
Reviews.Author: sharkm
Reviews.Content: We went there twice. Just fantastic. Truly luxurious. Best sea view you can get. Book directly at the hotel website- they have unbelievable special offers. And do not waste your time on standard rooms. Book Executive rooms (they give you access to Executive Lounge and are located at floors 14 and higher). Well worth the price. Last time we booked Executive Crest Corner room for about 240 euro per two (breakfast not included but not needed to be honest). View, spa, pool, snacks in executive lounge are all marvelous. My husband and i stayed there twice. And both times we were miraculously upgraded to a higher level room.

Reviews.Title: “Best conference/meeting hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EmineIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Extensive up state of the art meeting facilities, excellent banqueting food & beverage, very knowledgeable and attentive staff, so what else you expect when you go to a hotel for a conference as a meeting planner?

Reviews.Title: “Internatioanal Meeting Organization”
Reviews.Author: erhansenol
Reviews.Content: Great service with great Swissotel team. Thanks for all Swissotel Bosphorus team.

Reviews.Title: “perfect :)”
Reviews.Author: scka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Swissotel on June 09 with my collegues for business purpose. The staff were excellent and polite. The service is in high quality and the meeting rooms are very comfortable. Thanks all hotel staff for their best service during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great On-line price, spendy amenities”
Reviews.Author: GringoWim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in mid-July, 2009. The hotel itself is impressive, very large rooms, extremely comforable beds with delicious sheets. We were on the 6th floor, three floors below the reception/lobby level. My wife booked on-line, and by the time all was said and done, with taxes etc. we paid around 175Euro/night, cheap by 5 star standards. Drawbacks? EVERYTHING is expensive. Thank god the guy that checked us in comped us breakfast, becuase it costs something like 25Euros. I drank a whiskey in the lobby bar, and I think it ran me 24Euros. The hotel manager commented here that the business center offers 15-minute intervals for internet usage as an alternative to the 30Euro/day unlimited usage. What he neglected to point out is that the 15 minute time period for internet usage in the business center costs 5Euros or so... At that rate, you are better off going for the full day package. The spa is gorgeous. Newly renovated, etc. The outdoor pool is delightful as well, with attentive staff etc. The grounds are extremely pleasant, a nice oasis inside the hustle and bustle of this incredible city. I would probably go back to this hotel, but as a previous posted said, make sure you get any package that includes breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Hamor
Reviews.Content: Our flight was an early arrival one. So we arrived before the official 12:00 am check in time. Though I emailed the management, days earlier, on our arrival time with a reply that they will do their best depending on availability. Once there, we were informed that we have to wait since no rooms are available with no idea when they will be. We witnessed others checking in and getting their rooms while we were waiting! Same categories. Approaching the reception staff, the two guys bluntly, said that yes we will give them priority and rooms because you booked our special offer!!!! Requesting to talk to a manager, the young lady repeated what was said! So in short: it was our mistake that we took the hook of direct online swissotel special offer. That, upon check in, we were treated as second class inferior clients! For information our stay was ten nights long. As I fully enjoyed my first visit to Istanbul, Swissotel left me with an advise: to think twice before considering such a bad experience again. I will be going back to Istanbul but will stay and relax in other luxury hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay. There are loads of better paces to stay at thi price.”
Reviews.Author: Luitje
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on May 19-21 (went Istanbul for the UEFA Cup final). Booked a corner room with Bosphorus view, was given a room on the 7th floor (2 floors down from the reception) which was rather a pool view than Bosphorus. Beware, although the hotel quotes prices in euro, they charge it in Turkish Lira converted at the hotel rate, which is 10% higher than inetrbank rate. A trick practised widely in certain Asian countries, I still didn't expect Swissotel to play it on their guests. Using Internet is a hassle - at the rate of 25 euro per day, VPN doesn't work and the hotel honestly believe it is you who must sort things out with the IT team in your company. Pathetic. Asked to put my frequent traveller card through on chek-out. Took me some time to convince the girl at the reception Swissotel did partner with my airline. Apart from that everything was okay, but won't stay there again. For this price I would expect a hotel to be a bit more honest and their stuff bit slightly more friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view?”
Reviews.Author: Seanlovestravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary. We were supposed to have a Garden View room for the first night as all of the Bosphorous View Rooms had been booked. When we arrived we had been "upgraded" to a larger corner Garden View room - great we thought until we saw the view which was of the hotel front entrance where the taxis and coaches came in. Never mind we thought we will be moving to our Bosphorous View the next day. When we got retuned from a trip into the old town the next day our bags had been very efficiently moved to our new room - at last a view of the.... rooftop tennis court - you could see the Bosphorous but only if you stood in one corner of the room This time we complained and were shown a room on the same elevation but 4 floors down - a view of the road! Eventually we took up our case with the manager who told us that all bosphorous view rooms were partial view rooms unless you booked the more expensive corner room or suite. To be fair we were moved to a corner room with a fabulous view of the Bosphorous - finally we had what we thought we had paid for - but be careful about booking a standard room if you want a good view. The staff were generally excellent (especially the conciege team who found us a great reastuarant for our anniversary) as was the Spa Facility which really did provide a great way to wake up in the morning. The resaturants and bars good but were crazy money to the point of being prohibitive - 50 lira for 2 G&T's and 60 lira for 2 cocktails - but then we found this generally to be the case in Istanbul. We had taken 2 bottles of champagne with us purchased at the airpot (it was our anniversary!) and I would certainly recoomed that you take some alcohol with you. The location was pretty good with a cool modern district close by which was great for breakfast cafes, restaurants & bars full of locals and top brand shopping. The old town was easily reached by taxi the first morning but after that we used the very simple linear tram line which cost about 60p each and was a much better experience than a taxi. Overall we had a fabulous stay but would have been dissapointed with a standard room. Save up if you fancy a few late drinks in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of Bosporus”
Reviews.Author: Askimon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, mouthwatering food and amazing view of Bosporus see from any room

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous hotel”
Reviews.Author: EasternRabbits
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful week there with our kids. Restaurants and buffet of very fresh and various foods. The rooms are spacious, very nicely decorated and the service is very good. There is always someone to make sure that you don't need anything. Even if the room was not on a high floor, we got a very nice view from the pool, the garden and the Bosphorus ! Orchids everywhere were amazing of beauty. The experience at the spa was just unforgettable ! A hamman in a very traditional way made by an experienced person. Talking about relaxing time, all the family enjoy the inside pool and the fitness. All the services and people of the hotel were perfect. Especially with the kids. Comment from our kids: Waoooohhhhh ! Many thanks to the whole team and his management .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: o2travels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at various times for business purposes. It has great view and good services over all. This time I booked a Bosphorous view room over the internet. When we arrived late at night to check-in, we were given a room with a pool view instead. It took a while to convince the reception that this was not what I booked and was finally I was given a better rate to compensate. Not good enough in my view, given that I have chosen Swiss only to have a view of the Bosphorous.

Reviews.Title: “Gourgeous, every guest is a king!”
Reviews.Author: travelbee2008
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever seen (and I see about 40 of them every year). True gem. Sadly, but this level of service is only possible because it is in a low-wage country. You'd never find so much devotion in Switzerland or Austria.

Reviews.Title: “Credit crunch has not hit Swissotel !!”
Reviews.Author: NICK
Reviews.Content: Luxury spacious hotel with all the normal 5 star trappings , uniformed bellboys, beautiful marble reception area , efficient staff , luxury rooms (although possibly a bit dated by todays 5 star standard ) etc etc, . the hotel is on the northern side of Istanbul on the side of a hill overlooking the Bosphorus , reception is therefore on the 9th floor , to get the best view of the Bosphorus you really to need ideally to be on a floor above the reception , we were on the 8th floor and had a decent view but would not have wanted to be any lower . Breakfast was very very good indeed but its essential that its included in the room rate other wise its Â£25 per person !! . Some advice if you book via the Swissotel web site which offers over 20 'promotion' prices , go to the AMEX 'passion for europe' which gets you 15 percent disc , breakfast and late checkout ,also keep reviewing as the prices move all over the place (we cancelled and rebooked 4 times to save money!!) . Which brings me nicely onto my main point , a bottle of corrona is Â£10 , cocktails Â£16 , small Toberone (melted) from minibar Â£5, coke Â£6 , I have stayed in a few 5 stars hotels but have never seen such prices , the real insult was charging you Â£6 for the pleasure of making your own coffee in your room , this was a new one on me . The hotel was up a hill so to get the the sights in Sultanahmet you either got a cab or walked 20mins down the hill via an unmade pavement to pick up the excellent trams . The spa was great , nice pool , a selection of steam rooms ,would i stay here again , not sure , would prefer to be more central but would you get the space and luxury spa ???

Reviews.Title: “with goods and bads”
Reviews.Author: zoomendoscopist
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Swissotel in Feb 2009. The hotel is near Nisantasi which is a posh neighbourhoof in Istanbul with nice shops, restaurants and bars. It overlooks the Bosphorus and you can reach the Sultanahmet in 20 minutes by taxi if traffic allows. The rooms are spacious, nicely decorated and the service is fine. The rooms prices are cheap for this kind of hotel. However everything else is greatly overpriced..High speed internet is not free and is not charged by hour but is costs 30 euros per 24 hours...The breakfast [which is just ok] costs around 30 euros per person and a cocktail in the bar costs 16 euros!!!!. I had a massage treatment which was a nightmare...and greatly overpriced..100 euros for 50 minutes. It was the most boring massage i ever had. First time i was waiting for time to go by and leave [and i go very often to spas]...Maybe i was just unlucky cause my wife had, as she told me, a very good treatment the same day...

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pickie
Reviews.Content: Very good 5 star hotel with beautiful gardens and view. We stayed on a very confortable and spacious room with direct access to the pool and gardens but with no view. Excellent breakfast served in a lovely terrace with a magnificient Bosphorus view. The spa was closed for renovation but the outdoor pool was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Istanbul with a unique SPA!”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulEsra
Reviews.Content: I really very much enjoyed my stay at Swisshotel The Bosphorus. The staff is always kind and warm, which makes you feel home. It has a wonderful new Spa + fitness center, which is huge and elegant; the Spa has everything that one could ever need to relax and feel good and rejuvenated. The pool, the jacuzzi, the tropical shower, the soft water beds in the resting room with an amazing view of the night stars on the ceiling, they all I adored! And I had the best foot massage I have ever had in my life, the personnel are really professional.. and they know what they are doing. One can easily spend hours in that Spa without noticing the flow of time at all. I will always prefer Swisshotel The Bosphorus in Istanbul, with its central location, polite personnel, luxurious Spa and cozy rooms...

Reviews.Title: “had great weekend”
Reviews.Author: hekamede
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed had the Bosphorus view which was marvellous. Besides tried Chalet, Miyako and Gaja restaurants. Food, service and atmosphere in each one was perfect. They said that they newly opened a Spa so we tried that. Some parts were still under construction but we nearly spent 5 hours there. We highly recommend Amrita Spa to everyone who stays at Swissotel The Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel luxury”
Reviews.Author: MrsNappyValley
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at swissotel in Istanbul in May. The room offered wrap-around views from one end of the Bosphorus to the mosques and Topkapi Palace in the old town - an absolute luxury to savour from the comfort of your chaise longue. Decadent breakfasts were amazing, especially taken on the terrace overlooking the gardens and the sea. We were with our two toddlers who really enjoyed themselves, with the staff going out of their way to cater for them, down to the frequent teddy bears, chocolates and kiddie toiletries - they even managed a swim or two in the outdoor pool. A special mention goes to the super friendly guest relations and front desk staff who never let us walk past without a chat. I have never before taken the time to write a review but the swissotel experience deserves it and we recommend to everyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive”
Reviews.Author: cmmPaloAlto_Ca
Reviews.Content: I expected far more from such a highly rated hotel. While my room was comfortable, I found my stay to be terrifically overpriced. In spite of the relatively high base room rate and the fact that the hotel bills itself as a business center, all of the business-related services (computer use, printing, phone calls) were ridiculously expensive as were food and drinks at the hotel restaurants. I also found the concierge to be quite unhelpful when I asked for assistance with travel arrangements. Finally, while lovely, the hotel is relatively sterile and does not reflect much of the vibrant city around it. This Swissotel is reasonable only for the business traveller who truly has no regard either for his expense account or for experiencing the culture of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good!”
Reviews.Author: podeumdesejo
Reviews.Content: 6 stars ! Good view rooms, good food,good swimingpool,high quality!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, the pool is closed.”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoSandman
Reviews.Content: I'd read some of the reviews stating that drinks and food were expensive here, but nothing could prepare me for $45 dollar cocktails. Yeah, you read that right. Room rates at this well-appointed hotel are very reasonable, but they make up for it with outrageous prices on EVERYTHING else. I'm talking about double what you'ld pay in Paris, New York, or anywhere else. How would you like a $70 shot of Patron. Enough about prices. Most everything else was as expected, except it was very irritating to me that on two of the nights I was there, they closed the hotel's only pool for a private function. Why don't you just tell me you're renting out my balcony while you're at it?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but insane food and drink prices”
Reviews.Author: International_Baller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few weeks ago with my girlfriend when we went on vacation to see Turkey. The hotel was very nice and located within a short cab ride to Sultanmet, but dont expect to walk around to stores/restaurants as the location is pretty isolated for walking. We booked a Bosphorus view room which actually has a view at an angle, apparently the only rooms with direct views of the Bosphorus are the suites. The rooms were very nice and the service was excellent, especially the concierge. But beware of the food and drink prices, especially in the lobby lounge and rooftop bar. $20 for a drink! $10 for a coke! And even more absurd, $9 for a small bottle of water! It's so ridiculous that you almost have to laugh. Beyond that, it was an excellent hotel if you're not looking to spend the $$ for the Ciragan Palace or 4 seasons. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: veryberryNyc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Istanbul, where we spent 4 nights at the Swissotel, and we had a wonderful stay. From the time we arrived, the staff was consistently pleasant, helpful and professional, and made our stay really enjoyable. At check-in, we got a nice room with a view of the Bosphorus (despite booking the garden-view room on Cheaptickets for a steal at $300 with breakfast included), got a nice room at 1pm before official check-in time. The room was large, clean, beautifully furnished, with large bathroom and lots of closet/storage space. The towels were changed twice a day, and the turkish delight with the turn-down service was a nice touch. The breakfast area is beautiful, with a wide variety of options from American-style to continental to Turkish and even Japanese. The hostesses were always very pleasant, and the coffee/water service prompt. We had a couple of urgent requests for dry cleaning and pressing service (was there for a wedding) and everything was taken care of very promptly. Throughout our stay, everyone from the cleaning staff to the concierge to waiters seemed to enjoy helping guests and really made our stay memorable. The location is convenient, with quick and cheap taxi service anywhere (the taxi staff were also very helpful, explaining directions to the drivers and giving us the taxi plate numbers for each ride) - but I wouldn't walk anywhere from the hotel, since the sidewalk goes down a steep hill and it is not well paved. Overall, I will absolutely stay at this hotel when in Istanbul again - especially if I can get that rate again!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: mayla
Reviews.Content: You can sit in this hotel and watch the entire world go by. I can't think of another place where you can see women in string bikinis lounging at the pool, while women completely covered from head to toe are sipping coffee in the lobby. The views of the Bosphorus are stunning, and the breakfast is great. It's about 15 lira for a taxi to the Sultanahmet district. There are beautiful gardens with a jogging path in the rear of the hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Swisshotel Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Christinaki
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent three nights in the beginning of July in the Swisshotel and we loved it. We also liked its location very much. We had, what they call, a standard room with a view on the Bosphorus, and it was so big, so well kept, so well lit, with all the essential amenities (among which, bathrobes and slippers) and so well serviced that we enjoyed every minute of our stay. The breakfast buffet was one of the best we had in similar-class hotels, and they serve it in a lovely terrace with a view on the Bosphorus! Security is evident througout the hotel and during all day and night and the service is friendly and efficient. All in all it was a memorable stay. If I go to Istanbul again, I will definitely stay at the Swisshotel!

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: dokanman
Reviews.Content: Booked on hotel website and not having been to IST for 20 years requested car to pick me up at airport. Arrived airpot- no car. Waited 10-15 minutes (I didn't have hotel no. on me) and got a taxi, which was surprisingly very straightforward and honest compared to my last visit in the 80s. At check in told I had been upgraded to a club floor where I would find a lounge for breakfast, evening drinks etc. BUT if i wanted to use the lounge....... the receptionist launched into a sales pitch that for a modest charge etc. I was being hustled by check in!!!! I reminded him that I'd just spent 15 minutes waiting for their NO SHOW driver at airport, and I'd go and stay elsewhere. The lounge access was then given free of charge. SWISS HOSPITALITY!!! Wifi access is unnescessarily complicated and frustratingly difficult to access. Is this a business hotel or stop of point for americans on expensive package tours? Very pleasant, if busy pool area. Good food too, albeit weighted in favour of US carb bomb style. Room OK. Very good housekeeping service. Overall? Good enough, but propensity to nickle and dime - staff appear to have been on over intensive "up selling" classes at the expense of leaving the impression of any genuine hospitality. I suspect that there are better options elsewhere. Starwood opening a W soon ....s o live in hope!?
